commit_message:
set relnotesdir to default inside config

Rather than using a default value in the function signature, look for
None and set the default. This allows callers to not have to look for an
option to be defined to decide when to pass relnotesdir or not.

Change-Id: I8535db2f35fa69faa009b4d368b21e25735016ee
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Problem was the 'br-prv' endpoint that didn't have IP in case of VLAN

Closes-Bug: #1556917

commit_message:
Robust generating of routes

'netgroups[ngname]' is replaced with 'netgroups.get(ngname, {})' as
in other places in serializer.
Problem was the 'br-prv' endpoint that didn't have IP in case of VLAN
segmentation. The difference between 'netgroup_mapping' and 'netgroups'
exists only in case of using network template. Otherwise, absence of IP
for 'br-prv' did not lead to this issue.

Also, there is a small refactoring of serialization tests was made here.

Change-Id: I67616409017631023e707e533cb8e2faab943b34
Closes-Bug: #1556917

subject: Do not include Admin network twice
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14610, 'name': 'Denis V. Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 19234, 'name': 'Alexey Stupnikov', 'email': 'aleksey.stupnikov@gmail.com', 'username': 'astupnikov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-01 10:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_nic_assignment.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/network/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Do not include Admin network twice

Admin network was included into networks list twice in case of using
multiple node groups. Because of that the allocation algorithm had
an assumption that Admin network was not allocated to NIC and allocated
it twice, fisrt time - to the right NIC, second - to the first NIC always.
The issue arrived when node was in non-default node group and was booted
not from the first NIC. This issue was fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1557580
Change-Id: I64a9ecdad1e68e4f0819940f0266699c394e9caf
'}]
commit_message:
Do not include Admin network twice

Admin network was included into networks list twice in case of using
multiple node groups. Because of that the allocation algorithm had
an assumption that Admin network was not allocated to NIC and allocated
it twice, fisrt time - to the right NIC, second - to the first NIC always.
The issue arrived when node was in non-default node group and was booted
not from the first NIC. This issue was fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1557580
Change-Id: I64a9ecdad1e68e4f0819940f0266699c394e9caf

commit_message:
Add missing master node's logs to Diag Snapshot

MOS 8.0 Diagnostic Snapshot doesn't contain essential log files.
Examples are messages, security, cron files and anaconda, sa
directories. This issue will complicate troubleshooting and needs to
be fixed.

Change-Id: I59875f25a3d418133a12e92ad6604e6f14f5fbaa
Closes-Bug: #1544966

commit_message:
Add common testing repo to OpenStack-Ansible

In order to facilitate a common testing implementation across
all roles instead of maintaining copies of the basic scaffolding
across multiple repositories, OpenStack-Ansible is implementing
a new repository to store the common scaffolding.

Needed-By: Ib075e76a202ec931a0d0b57c81270d3b3634cad9
Change-Id: Ib9a3fc36bc5cd8ff946dbe7fea77bc0df2b92b53

commit_message:
Application Development Framework

Build a library of MuranoPL classes to define basic building blocks
for the applications utilizing standard patterns for scaling, load
balancing, healing etc, allow the apps to be deployed on various
clouds (supporting both multiple regions of OpenStack and other cloud
types as well).

Change-Id: I84d4f3dfec861f282602e57f076b16d3dc4c7556

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-03 23:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': "Forbid ironic grenade job from building ramdisk

Because DEVSTACK_GATE explicitly sets
DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=1 unless it's set otherwise, without
setting this explicitly, grenade jobs will always have a ramdisk custom
built, which is prone to more errors vs using the prebuilt ones with no
additional benefit.

Additionally, updated two misconfigured jobs to set build-ramdisk to an
empty string, as expected, instead of 1.

Change-Id: Icc56830fe07f01631058ef9aece7cdf11c0ffc4d
Related-bug: 1607981
"}]
commit_message:
Forbid ironic grenade job from building ramdisk

Because DEVSTACK_GATE explicitly sets
DEVSTACK_GATE_IRONIC_BUILD_RAMDISK=1 unless it's set otherwise, without
setting this explicitly, grenade jobs will always have a ramdisk custom
built, which is prone to more errors vs using the prebuilt ones with no
additional benefit.

Additionally, updated two misconfigured jobs to set build-ramdisk to an
empty string, as expected, instead of 1.

Change-Id: Icc56830fe07f01631058ef9aece7cdf11c0ffc4d
Related-bug: 1607981

NetApp cDOT controllers can mix SSDs and spinning disks
in the same aggregate, where the SSDs are used for a
cache.  This commit reports the hybrid aggregate attribute
to the scheduler for each pool for use in extra specs
matching.  This commit also ensures that all aggregate
values reported to the Cinder scheduler correctly include
a vendor-specific prefix.

Implements: blueprint netapp-report-cdot-hybrid-aggrs
Change-Id: I8fbfbe3ffaad5fe89db03d2a4e567e9b35e59d5b
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Report hybrid aggregates in volume stats

NetApp cDOT controllers can mix SSDs and spinning disks
in the same aggregate, where the SSDs are used for a
cache.  This commit reports the hybrid aggregate attribute
to the scheduler for each pool for use in extra specs
matching.  This commit also ensures that all aggregate
values reported to the Cinder scheduler correctly include
a vendor-specific prefix.

Implements: blueprint netapp-report-cdot-hybrid-aggrs
Change-Id: I8fbfbe3ffaad5fe89db03d2a4e567e9b35e59d5b

commit_message:
return the name of the cache file created

Have the function that creates the cache file return the name of the
file created so the caller doesn't have to know how that name is
constructed from default values.

Change-Id: I576045e1591badc84722e28072c7aed36a35be38
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Implement tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Implement tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades job

Add a new experimental job in the serie of upgrade testing:
gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades-nv

This job will deploy an undercloud and a single node overcloud (nonha)

Experimental and non voting for now.

commit_message:
Implement tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades job

Add a new experimental job in the serie of upgrade testing:
gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-upgrades-nv

This job will deploy an undercloud and a single node overcloud (nonha)
on Mitaka, and upgrade it to Newton.

Experimental and non voting for now.

Change-Id: I2ab87862a019e983c1a4b06a52e8de7bd8a5af51

commit_message:
Timing metrics for agent deploy classes

This change adds timing metrics for all agent deploy classes. The only
methods we are not emitting metrics for are those that return static
results.

Change-Id: I96290be44a60635f3bd68e7a43549e2f67a19f12
Related-bug: #1526219

As the cinder volumes are presented to VMs as local vdisks by GPFS
cinder driver and we are not using "gpfs" (TCP/IP) protocol in volume
operation.

Change-Id: I7cc278b019fb972598d7d15c18d779978ed9c235
'}]
commit_message:
Changing "driver_volume_type" flag of GPFS driver to "local"

As the cinder volumes are presented to VMs as local vdisks by GPFS
cinder driver and we are not using "gpfs" (TCP/IP) protocol in volume
operation.

Change-Id: I7cc278b019fb972598d7d15c18d779978ed9c235

The instacllation doc should provide the senlin dashboard install
in devstack method, because horizon is a core service, many
developer will install this service. And if the developer want
to develop senlin-dashboard there is no doc instruction to guide

commit_message:
Correct the installation doc

The instacllation doc should provide the senlin dashboard install
in devstack method, because horizon is a core service, many
developer will install this service. And if the developer want
to develop senlin-dashboard there is no doc instruction to guide
them how to install this horizon plugin.
Besides, there is a incorrect step in the install guide.

Change-Id: I375f04cb1e2621ce59740770566692e6643add05

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-05-05 20:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': 'Neutron: configure requested amount of fixed_ips

The code would only configure one fixed IP irrespective
if there were more than one port configured on the instance.
This was done in commit 55af31cfec74244de4efbc7187a548972c4d99f3.

The patch does a number of things:
1. it will only allocate a fixed ip if there is no fixed ip allocated
   on the port
2. It will only do this once per port
3. If will do for all ports on the instance

It is not even clear if this feature is actually used.

Change-Id: Ib143694e76e6456bf7226047a2a70c437c7002a3
Closes-bug: #1430512
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron: configure requested amount of fixed_ips

The code would only configure one fixed IP irrespective
if there were more than one port configured on the instance.
This was done in commit 55af31cfec74244de4efbc7187a548972c4d99f3.

The patch does a number of things:
1. it will only allocate a fixed ip if there is no fixed ip allocated
   on the port
2. It will only do this once per port
3. If will do for all ports on the instance

It is not even clear if this feature is actually used.

Change-Id: Ib143694e76e6456bf7226047a2a70c437c7002a3
Closes-bug: #1430512

commit_message:
Neutron: remove future warnings

Remove warnings in the neutron unit tests that contain:

    FutureWarning: fake is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields with
    invalid UUIDs is no longer supported, and will be removed in
    a future release. Please update your code to input valid UUIDs
    or accept ValueErrors for invalid UUIDs

commit_message:
Optionally remove portage files

Optionally remove portage files, so that we can cache package and
keep the portage directory around, specifically for nodepool.

This also adds a section to the Gentoo readme about the variable
and renames the 00-gentoo-distro-name environment file to a more
appropriate name of 00-gentoo-envars.

Also brought up was the location of the gentoo-releng.gpg file,
this has been moved and the refrencing paths updated.

Change-Id: I20c91b36082828faa1ca481585acc5f9933211e1

subject: Revert "i18n: trim whitespaces in extracted messages"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 17:11:54.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/babel_extract_angular.py', 'horizon/utils/babel_extract_angular.py'], 'message': 'Revert "i18n: trim whitespaces in extracted messages"

This reverts commit f87b58fcabf84c9b73b07b587416cc0b6cc814b1.
In https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1592965,
extracted messages are stored with trimming.
After this change, strings with multi lines cannot be translated.

This change cause the difference between the real strings in html
and a key in pot, from the view point of extra spaces and break lines.
Message extraction is done by babel (with horizon specific extractor),
but translation message lookup is done by angular-gettext.
As a result, a key used in translation lookup becomes different from
a key generated by the message extraction.
Keys in both steps should be same.
So this patch reverts the corresponding commit to make translation
work, even though it may be annoying for translators again.

Regarding the comment from i18n perspective, see Akihiro's comment
in patch set 3 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347725

Closes-Bug: #1606837
Change-Id: I651a2f39fdc0209f702cb9cf45691c944382b897
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "i18n: trim whitespaces in extracted messages"

This reverts commit f87b58fcabf84c9b73b07b587416cc0b6cc814b1.
In https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1592965,
extracted messages are stored with trimming.
After this change, strings with multi lines cannot be translated.

This change cause the difference between the real strings in html
and a key in pot, from the view point of extra spaces and break lines.
Message extraction is done by babel (with horizon specific extractor),
but translation message lookup is done by angular-gettext.
As a result, a key used in translation lookup becomes different from
a key generated by the message extraction.
Keys in both steps should be same.
So this patch reverts the corresponding commit to make translation
work, even though it may be annoying for translators again.

Regarding the comment from i18n perspective, see Akihiro's comment
in patch set 3 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347725

Closes-Bug: #1606837
Change-Id: I651a2f39fdc0209f702cb9cf45691c944382b897

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-30 15:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())

Change-Id: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c
'}]
commit_message:
Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.

sys.exit(main())

Change-Id: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-08-02 08:55:04.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/test_service_clients.py', 'tempest/service_clients.py'], 'message': 'Optional setting service client on factory

Add the ability to store a copy of an initialised service client
on the service client factory, accessible via an attribute named
as a specified alias.

This allows to stop initialising all clients at __init__ time,
while preserving the ability to initialise them only once, for
instance in the setup_clients phase of tests.

Change-Id: I8b2a907f68214dd1fce1d057408d3ddd1e4bdc0a
Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor
'}]
commit_message:
Optional setting service client on factory

Add the ability to store a copy of an initialised service client
on the service client factory, accessible via an attribute named
as a specified alias.

This allows to stop initialising all clients at __init__ time,
while preserving the ability to initialise them only once, for
instance in the setup_clients phase of tests.

Change-Id: I8b2a907f68214dd1fce1d057408d3ddd1e4bdc0a
Partially-implements: bp client-manager-refactor

commit_message:
Fix stale docstring in SegmentedIterable.

At some point, we added stuff to listing_iter, but didn't update the
docstring. I noticed this while trying to write code using a
SegmentedIterable when it wouldn't take my 3-tuples like the docstring
claimed it would.

Change-Id: I8f6667e97b1277f5b403a5f6fa7f9d708bb19249

commit_message:
Towards non-locking model: Add 'unique_key' for delayed calls

* In our upcoming engine changes we need the ability to schedule
  delayed calls so that we could restrict a number of certain
  calls by providing a unique key which in combination with
  'processing' flag composes a database unique constraint
* Added DB API methods for getting and deleting all delayed calls
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I35eba1395bef405e24aff01ad898f9e19f557b99

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix for creation of network environment twice

The patch solves the problem of creation of network, router, subnet
in tempest and neutron (twice).
As we want to create the network environment in the neutron test only,
the get_client_manager should be called by BaseNetworkTest object,
when cls.network_resources dict is already populated and then
the tempest will not create a new env (if it is empty it creates a new
network setup)

Closes-Bug: #1607903
Change-Id: I73fea24af201be1bd8d6cac204234f490f5113ba
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for creation of network environment twice

The patch solves the problem of creation of network, router, subnet
in tempest and neutron (twice).
As we want to create the network environment in the neutron test only,
the get_client_manager should be called by BaseNetworkTest object,
when cls.network_resources dict is already populated and then
the tempest will not create a new env (if it is empty it creates a new
network setup)

Closes-Bug: #1607903
Change-Id: I73fea24af201be1bd8d6cac204234f490f5113ba

commit_message:
Create a base class for tempest tests

The tempest tests (gate-functional-dsvm-magnum-api) requires
importing modules that other tests don't require. Right now, we
import tempest modules in the common base class, which is
undesirable. This commit splitted tempest codes out so that other
tests don't need to import tempest modules.

Change-Id: I4871acdc27d66e098e2321809d7d31d4e8416abf
Related-Bug: #1596778
Closes-Bug: #1553035

commit_message:
Update setup.cfg for memory bandwidth monitor

This patch builds on top of a series of patches that introduce
the memory bandwidth filter in nova.

This patch introduces the entry point for the memory bandwidth
monitor in the setup.cfg file.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: Ia3238bc8f626528b28dd0d00242dcf7d8697b337

commit_message:
Base enablement for memory bandwidth monitor

This patch introduces two new methods in the driver base class
that will be used for determining the memory bandwidth of a given
host node.

In addition to this, this patch also implements the methods for the
libvirt driver.

Change-Id: I71e1a44d248fc54b851925589e5cd1cfd68a07e7
Partially-Implements: blueprint memory-bw

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-06-29 14:35:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/monitors/mem_bw/__init__.py', 'nova/compute/monitors/mem_bw/virt_driver.py', 'nova/compute/monitors/base.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/monitors/mem_bw/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/monitors/mem_bw/test_virt_driver.py'], 'message': "Introduce the memory bandwidth monitor

This patch defines the numa memory bandwidth monitor.
The monitor inherits itself from the existing monitor base class.

The monitor calculates the memory bandwidth by reading the PMU
counter values via PcP. The rate is determined by calculating
the difference between two consecutive reads of the driver API
divided by the time difference. This allows nova to have a control
over the time period to represent the bandwidth instead of storing
instantenous values.

The maximum memory bandwidth is reported in the rate format and hence
the above time difference calculation doesn't apply. The maximum
memory bandwidth is not expected to change unless new memory units
are plugged into the host.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I1959eba1966765d71e4e6ef1475026689f8c00dc
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce the memory bandwidth monitor

This patch defines the numa memory bandwidth monitor.
The monitor inherits itself from the existing monitor base class.

The monitor calculates the memory bandwidth by reading the PMU
counter values via PcP. The rate is determined by calculating
the difference between two consecutive reads of the driver API
divided by the time difference. This allows nova to have a control
over the time period to represent the bandwidth instead of storing
instantenous values.

The maximum memory bandwidth is reported in the rate format and hence
the above time difference calculation doesn't apply. The maximum
memory bandwidth is not expected to change unless new memory units
are plugged into the host.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I1959eba1966765d71e4e6ef1475026689f8c00dc

commit_message:
Install pcp on n-cpu nodes

As a part of the memory bandwidth monitor, nova would attempt to
install pcp and it's associated python-bindings.

This commit tries to install pcp. Even though it's only going to
be used if the memory bandwidth monitor is enabled.

Related to blueprint memory-bw

Change-Id: I78b284e301294b4838f31136ebec7ca7bd546aca

commit_message:
Introduce utility module for pcp

This patchset introduces the pcp utility module.

This module consists of a PCPDriver that connects to the pcp
daemon and is used to fetch metric values from pcp in general.

There shall be a dependent patchset, which would use this
utility module to obtain values related to the memory bandwidth
for the memory bandwidth monitor.

Co-Authored-By: Abhishek Dasgupta <a10gupta@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I884ff2e15ec4fbb1e984abd3532a57fba2aa4f0d
Partially-Implements: blueprint memory-bw

subject: tempest: stop creating network resources for each test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:17:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/base.py'], 'message': 'tempest: stop creating network resources for each test

The way get_client_manager was overridden in neutron, it never used
network_resources set by set_network_resources() on a test class,
because the parent get_client_manager implementation was triggered on
the base class instead of on super() result, which made the class passed
into the parent method implementation different from the test class
under setup.

This small change disables network resource creation for all in tree
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I7493adbc9e3a037ef99dc75c42bc420ccc1fd7d3
Closes-Bug: #1607903
'}]
commit_message:
tempest: stop creating network resources for each test

The way get_client_manager was overridden in neutron, it never used
network_resources set by set_network_resources() on a test class,
because the parent get_client_manager implementation was triggered on
the base class instead of on super() result, which made the class passed
into the parent method implementation different from the test class
under setup.

This small change disables network resource creation for all in tree
tempest tests.

Change-Id: I7493adbc9e3a037ef99dc75c42bc420ccc1fd7d3
Closes-Bug: #1607903

commit_message:
Rename DB columns: tenant -> project

All occurences of ``tenant_id`` across the database are renamed
to ``project_id``. Both options are equally valid, but ``project_id``
is preferred.
To inform external users about the change, HasTenant class was
deprecated.

UpgradeImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

Change-Id: I87a8ef342ccea004731ba0192b23a8e79bc382dc

subject: Bump up oslo.config that works with glance-store releases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 19:58:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Bump up oslo.config that works with glance-store releases

With the oslo.config release 3.14.0 the bug 1605648 that affected
glance_store releases of 0.14.0 and 0.15.0 will no longer fail the
glance docs gates. So, with the bump glance can use the prior releases
of store.

Change-Id: Ic5c50ed4217dcd9b8d93916421f5334100a0b4e1
'}]
commit_message:
Bump up oslo.config that works with glance-store releases

With the oslo.config release 3.14.0 the bug 1605648 that affected
glance_store releases of 0.14.0 and 0.15.0 will no longer fail the
glance docs gates. So, with the bump glance can use the prior releases
of store.

Change-Id: Ic5c50ed4217dcd9b8d93916421f5334100a0b4e1

commit_message:
Pass agent metrics config via conductor

This adds agent config options for metrics as described in the
spec, and allows those config options to be sent to IPA on
lookup. We're configuring heartbeat timeout this way, and this
change matches nicely with that style.

Additionally, this sets heartbeat_timeout under the new config
namespace for consistency, however, we'll allow the old way to
be deprecated when the vendor_passthru for agent lookups is
deprecated.

Change-Id: I94d81b95feabe46999dbbc02522508cd542a89f8
Co-Authored-By: Josh Gachnang <josh@pcsforeducation.com>
Partial-bug: #1526219

commit_message:
tempest: only deploy neutron fwaas and lbaas

Be more granular on what package we deploy for Tempest tests.
Our current CI only test LBaaS and FWaaS, not VPNaaS.

Change-Id: Ic53b462a3bcb9a1329ee8017f72e33f1201c64f1
Depends-On: Ied0881f93a020ba1954334e0c7549c216e6b76b1

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 16:30:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I9502b0b42ed742d64517be5463e3c5f65eba61c1
Closes-bug: #1604734
'}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I9502b0b42ed742d64517be5463e3c5f65eba61c1
Closes-bug: #1604734

If tests are run under py27 then run under py34 or py35, user may get
`db type could not be determined` error.

This patch adds a note to the dev-quickstart guide telling user to
remove the file `.testrepository/times.dbm` and then run the py34 or

Closes-Bug: #1229445 (regarding Ironic)

commit_message:
Fix for "db type could not be determined" error message

If tests are run under py27 then run under py34 or py35, user may get
`db type could not be determined` error.

This patch adds a note to the dev-quickstart guide telling user to
remove the file `.testrepository/times.dbm` and then run the py34 or
py35 test to work around this error.

Change-Id: I57b583eaa8586d14cee730eefc515ad064ac8b32
Closes-Bug: #1229445 (regarding Ironic)

commit_message:
Update xiv_ds8k driver name and description

The xiv_ds8k driver now supports IBM XIV, Spectrum Accelerate,
FlashSystem A9000, FlashSystem A9000R and DS8000 storage systems.
Therefore it should be renamed to IBM Storage driver.

The actual change includes:
- text changes in comments and documentation
- changes in fields in cinder.conf
- change in variable names
- change in file names

Implements: blueprint rename-xiv-ds8k-driver
Change-Id: Ia53a60e865ddac21029ca8518b6a506cb1682c51
DocImpact

revisions:

Allow to whether or not install aaS services (Firewall, VPN and LB) for
Neutron Service.

The logic will still require neutron_available to be True.

Depends-On: Iecddedc1ca6225e407cad04bdd5558e66f8d9e4d

'}]
commit_message:
neutron: add granularity for aas services

Allow to whether or not install aaS services (Firewall, VPN and LB) for
Neutron Service.

The logic will still require neutron_available to be True.
If Neutron is enable, Firewall and LB will be enable by default to
successfuly run Tempest.

Depends-On: Iecddedc1ca6225e407cad04bdd5558e66f8d9e4d
Change-Id: Ied0881f93a020ba1954334e0c7549c216e6b76b1

Currently Octavia assumes that DHCP service is available on
the VIP and member subnets.  This is not the case at all operators.
This patch makes Octavia use the IP information provided when

commit_message:
Fixes Octavia handling of subnets without DHCP

Currently Octavia assumes that DHCP service is available on
the VIP and member subnets.  This is not the case at all operators.
This patch makes Octavia use the IP information provided when
the ports are created, if available.  If the IP information is
not available on the ports it will fall back to relying on DHCP.

Change-Id: I08a93d4318bbce48128019376320782d1a334369
Closes-Bug: #1607900

commit_message:
Fixes nova host configuration on control nodes

Closes-Bug: 1604907

nova.conf and neutron.conf is not being configured with host,
resulting in lack of fqdn in host for nova services on the control
nodes.  Upon reboot duplicate instances of nova services are found
with correct fqdn on their hostname.  This fixes nova and neutron
conf to set the host value in controller manifests, similar to how
it is done in compute manifest.

This is a backport of Ieb793b9e9fd2dfc98584691412f9991aa99e0b47

Change-Id: Ie11b39de35194c020a8a09b57fdb11e882c5ec7b
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Sync neutron callbacks into lib

Update neutron-lib callbacks with the latest from neutron
in preparation for updates to the callback notification interface.
The callback updates also require a few module level functions
in the db package.

A few additional unit tests are also added for coverage as is
python docstrings for the public API contained herein.

Change-Id: I74effcc4a564a92c418132042bbdd5bed22c4950

Also a fix is needed in python-tripleoclient because it is hard coded to

commit_message:
Fixes type and description for NeutronL3HA

puppet-neutron takes this variable as boolean.  Although it doesn't
change the behavior in master (because the variable is used directly as
config), in mitaka it is used as a conditional and should be properly
fixed.

Also a fix is needed in python-tripleoclient because it is hard coded to
be True there based on number of controllers being greater than 1.
Therefore we shoudl remove that logic from tripleoclient and implement
it in THT.  In order to do that the pacemaker version of the variable is
defaulted to true.

Partial-Bug: 1605379

Change-Id: I0b797dbe188382e2dc32506913aaa60a0a21bd68
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8d0497d819a0f7e75eaae8531218ca7890d8ed7b)

commit_message:
Add trunk commands to openstackclient

This patch introduces the client bindings for the trunk
extension. It uses the openstackclient framework, and
thus requires the openstack client to work.

New commands introduced are as follows:
"openstack network trunk create" to create a trunk.
"openstack network trunk set" to update/add subports to a trunk.
"openstack network trunk unset" to remove subports from trunk.
"openstack network trunk list" to list all trunks.
"openstack network trunk delete" to delete trunks.
"openstack subport list --trunk <name>" to list all subports
belonging to a trunk.

DocImpact: Openstackclient now supports CLIs to configure
           trunk resource via OSC plugin for neutronclient

Change-Id: I6fe1dbd81813fae234801a61c0e3d89f9e7c791e
Co-authored-by: SongmingYan <yan.songming@zte.com.cn>
Co-authored-by: Abhishek Raut <rauta@vmware.com>
Partial-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-02 17:30:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/services/l3_router/l3_router_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_db.py'], 'message': 'Support callbacks for L3 plugins without an agent

Agentless L3 plugins, such as used by networking-ovn, were required
to inherit from L3_NAT_db_mixin instead of L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin due
to an L3 NAT DB signature mismatch which was fixed by [1]. With [1]
fix, agentless L3 plugins would still implicitly pick up callbacks
intended for use by L3 agents. Such callbacks will fail unless the
L3 plugin inherits from L3_NAT_db_mixin. This patch supports
callbacks for L3 plugins without an agent. The callbacks
have been refactored and are now done implicitly during object
creation. As a result, the l3_db subscribe() method has been
deprecated.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348558/

Change-Id: Id5dd012ffd274314f7d1b39a28525893e0675500
Partial-Bug: #1597898
'}]
commit_message:
Support callbacks for L3 plugins without an agent

Agentless L3 plugins, such as used by networking-ovn, were required
to inherit from L3_NAT_db_mixin instead of L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin due
to an L3 NAT DB signature mismatch which was fixed by [1]. With [1]
fix, agentless L3 plugins would still implicitly pick up callbacks
intended for use by L3 agents. Such callbacks will fail unless the
L3 plugin inherits from L3_NAT_db_mixin. This patch supports
callbacks for L3 plugins without an agent. The callbacks
have been refactored and are now done implicitly during object
creation. As a result, the l3_db subscribe() method has been
deprecated.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348558/

Change-Id: Id5dd012ffd274314f7d1b39a28525893e0675500
Partial-Bug: #1597898

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 21:09:38.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/ceph/radosgw.pp'], 'message': 'Revert "ensure ceph user/group"

The original commit was aimed to fix an issue with ceph deployment.

In jewel release radosgw service is executed as 'ceph' user, and in
'hammer' it was 'root' user. Puppet manifests configure all files in
/etc/ceph for 'root' user access only. Now (in jewel) radosgw keyring
file needed to be chowned to allow ceph user read it's content.
Without that ceph installation in Xenial is broken.

This was done in I0ad62b36293e70b5799f3c2dc39b4b2babd08813 and worked
well until tests agains 'hammer' release were run. In 'hammer' there is
no 'ceph' user / group, so changing permissions failed.

We tryied (incorrectly) to fix this by adding user / group in puppet,
and run into race condition between puppet and ceph package when they
both were trying to add / modify user.

So we decided to revert this change and only set correct permissions
to keyring file assuming that user / group 'ceph' already exist.

This reverts commit 822a55230c207ad9cb914905fc213f0fa4b6a698.

Change-Id: I31cd68336a0a264a8a055aa0f8b637a613b8e2d5
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "ensure ceph user/group"

The original commit was aimed to fix an issue with ceph deployment.

In jewel release radosgw service is executed as 'ceph' user, and in
'hammer' it was 'root' user. Puppet manifests configure all files in
/etc/ceph for 'root' user access only. Now (in jewel) radosgw keyring
file needed to be chowned to allow ceph user read it's content.
Without that ceph installation in Xenial is broken.

This was done in I0ad62b36293e70b5799f3c2dc39b4b2babd08813 and worked
well until tests agains 'hammer' release were run. In 'hammer' there is
no 'ceph' user / group, so changing permissions failed.

We tryied (incorrectly) to fix this by adding user / group in puppet,
and run into race condition between puppet and ceph package when they
both were trying to add / modify user.

So we decided to revert this change and only set correct permissions
to keyring file assuming that user / group 'ceph' already exist.

This reverts commit 822a55230c207ad9cb914905fc213f0fa4b6a698.

Change-Id: I31cd68336a0a264a8a055aa0f8b637a613b8e2d5

commit_message:
Clean up the introductory text in the docs

I made a few specific changes, hopefully for the better:

- Removed the "Welcome!" from the title, which is quite verbose in the
  sidebar index (and reads awkwardly as a title, IMO).

- Revised the project description to match what's on our Launchpad page,
  https://launchpad.net/keystone

- Revised the target audience to more accurately reflect who we actually
  write for (it's still contributors first, but it's not fair to ignore
  operators, etc).

Change-Id: I9955f31216e7a70fed10501f096001433609ac70

commit_message:
network: make nova to handle port_security_enabled=False

In somes cases we need to have network without any security rules
applied, unfortunatly nova does not provide way to remove l3
assignements and always at least expose the default security group.
This commit updates code to clear security groups applied to the
network when option port_security_enabled=False is activated on the
network.

Change-Id: I630008a9733624a9d9b59b7aa3b8b2a3f8985d61
Closes-Bug: #1460630

commit_message:
Add package requirements for encryption

Since object body and metadata encryption were added to swift there is a
new apt pkg requirement: libssl-dev

This is required to install pip packages correctly for Swift, and the
gate will fail without this package.

Change-Id: I395e359bae0198dfc26b8ecc04bb4df7e1152aac

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 12040, 'name': 'A10 Networks CI', 'email': 'a10-openstack-ci@a10networks.com', 'username': 'a10networks-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 07:45:33.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py'], 'message': "Fix for UnmappedInstanceError thrown during neutron lbaas-loadbalancer delete

During loadbalancer delete in the liberty code in certain corner case where
Amphora agent never reports the heartbeat to the octavia controller.
After load balancer creation the health manager updates the health status of
amphora in the amphora_health table . Since none of the heartbeat received
from the amphora agent and hence no entry is created in 'amphora_health'
table And eventually it goes PENDING_DELETE during delete .

This fix handles UnmappedInstanceError when there is no entries represented
in the octavia DB for the amphora health.

Closes-Bug: #1609235

Conflicts:
	octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py

Change-Id: Ib149c7c93ae2f0ad97b09cbcb5668a8872f01879
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for UnmappedInstanceError thrown during neutron lbaas-loadbalancer delete

During loadbalancer delete in the liberty code in certain corner case where
Amphora agent never reports the heartbeat to the octavia controller.
After load balancer creation the health manager updates the health status of
amphora in the amphora_health table . Since none of the heartbeat received
from the amphora agent and hence no entry is created in 'amphora_health'
table And eventually it goes PENDING_DELETE during delete .

This fix handles UnmappedInstanceError when there is no entries represented
in the octavia DB for the amphora health.

Closes-Bug: #1609235

Conflicts:
	octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py

Change-Id: Ib149c7c93ae2f0ad97b09cbcb5668a8872f01879

commit_message:
Add warning for plugins without notifications

Per the IRC meeting conversation in the referenced blueprint,
we decided to warn for plugins that don't support notifications.
We also wanted to ensure that the documentation provided information
about how to handle these types of plugins. This patch does that.

Change-Id: I3bca9c5ecc9bb387d4d766cbdbc23212e576f685
Implements: blueprint warn-for-types-without-notifications

commit_message:
pci: add safe-guard to __eq__ of PciDevice

We want to only compare a PciDevice object with an other PCIDevice
object. This patch adds that condition to avoid any exceptions raised
if we compare it for example with a NULL value.

Change-Id: I67f0ccb1e931ed327bc844eefc684754302d74d2
(cherry picked from commit 7268006a2ff7094e04b05f50f133c876789df307)

subject: virt/hardware: Fix 'isolate' case on non-SMT hosts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 09:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': 'virt/hardware: Fix 'isolate' case on non-SMT hosts

The 'isolate' policy is supposed to function on both hosts with an
SMT architecture (e.g. HyperThreading) and those without. The former
is true, but the latter is broken due to a an underlying implementation
detail in how vCPUs are "packed" onto pCPUs.

The '_pack_instance_onto_cores' function expects to work with a list of
sibling sets. Since non-SMT hosts don't have siblings, the function is
being given a list of all cores as one big sibling set. However, this
conflicts with the idea that, in the 'isolate' case, only one sibling
from each sibling set should be used. Using one sibling from the one
available sibling set means it is not possible to schedule instances
with more than one vCPU.

Resolve this mismatch by instead providing the function with a list of
multiple sibling sets, each containing a single core.

This also resolves another bug. When booting instances on a non-HT
host, the resulting NUMA topology should not define threads. By
correctly considering the cores on these systems as non-siblings,
the resulting instance topology will contain multiple cores with only
a single thread in each.

Change-Id: I2153f25fdb6382ada8e62fddf4215d9a0e3a6aa7
Closes-bug: #1550317
Closes-bug: #1417723
(cherry picked from commit 0b2e34f92507fd490faaec3285049b28446dc94c)
'}]
commit_message:
virt/hardware: Fix 'isolate' case on non-SMT hosts

The 'isolate' policy is supposed to function on both hosts with an
SMT architecture (e.g. HyperThreading) and those without. The former
is true, but the latter is broken due to a an underlying implementation
detail in how vCPUs are "packed" onto pCPUs.

The '_pack_instance_onto_cores' function expects to work with a list of
sibling sets. Since non-SMT hosts don't have siblings, the function is
being given a list of all cores as one big sibling set. However, this
conflicts with the idea that, in the 'isolate' case, only one sibling
from each sibling set should be used. Using one sibling from the one
available sibling set means it is not possible to schedule instances
with more than one vCPU.

Resolve this mismatch by instead providing the function with a list of
multiple sibling sets, each containing a single core.

This also resolves another bug. When booting instances on a non-HT
host, the resulting NUMA topology should not define threads. By
correctly considering the cores on these systems as non-siblings,
the resulting instance topology will contain multiple cores with only
a single thread in each.

Change-Id: I2153f25fdb6382ada8e62fddf4215d9a0e3a6aa7
Closes-bug: #1550317
Closes-bug: #1417723
(cherry picked from commit 0b2e34f92507fd490faaec3285049b28446dc94c)

commit_message:
Don't raise error when filtering on custom metadata

Hosts can have custom metadata. There is no restriction on the key names
used in this metadata, so we should not be raising an exception when
checking for the existence of any metadata key.

Originally worked on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271401

Co-Authored-By: Xiaowei Qian <xiaowei.qian@easystack.cn>

Closes-Bug: #1537062

Change-Id: Ie5ff3c1847e9c4533822a77d443e4ce1fcf047fe
(cherry picked from commit 85a307d3385ecfd641d7842c6450325410f2d3ba)

Re-re-propose ironic-multiple-compute-hosts

This re-writes the ironic-multiple-compute-hosts spec to use a hash
ring, rather than messing around with how we schedule.

Change-Id: I51de94e3fbe301aeed35a6456ed0b7350aefa317

subject: Cancel nested stack creation when sibling fails
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-28 16:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py'], 'message': 'Cancel nested stack creation when sibling fails

When a resource fails and a sibling resource in the same stack is a nested
stack and is being created, we should (gracefully) cancel the creation of
the nested stack. This allows the user to correct the issue and try to
recover the stack with a stack update within a reasonable period of time.
Otherwise, they have to wait for the entire nested stack to complete, fail
or time out before they will be able to successfully do an update to
correct the problem.

Change-Id: I02c3894718d595282f57ca63dc2c2ba9b7baa440
Closes-Bug: #1591341
'}]
commit_message:
Cancel nested stack creation when sibling fails

When a resource fails and a sibling resource in the same stack is a nested
stack and is being created, we should (gracefully) cancel the creation of
the nested stack. This allows the user to correct the issue and try to
recover the stack with a stack update within a reasonable period of time.
Otherwise, they have to wait for the entire nested stack to complete, fail
or time out before they will be able to successfully do an update to
correct the problem.

Change-Id: I02c3894718d595282f57ca63dc2c2ba9b7baa440
Closes-Bug: #1591341

commit_message:
Add support for microversion 2.33

This change allows novaclient to get several hypervisors
with the help of new optional parameters 'limit' and 'marker'
which were added to hipervisor-list command.

subject: Extend the "configuring ironic-api behind mod_wsgi" guide
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 10:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst'], 'message': 'Extend the "configuring ironic-api behind mod_wsgi" guide

The etc/apache2/ironic configuration have the logs file path pointing to
/var/log/apache2/ which does not exist in the Red Hat systems (the
equivalent is /var/log/httpd). This patch extend the documentation to
point that out to the operator to look at these paths when setting up
the ironic-api to run behing Apache mod_wsgi.

Related-Bug: #1608252
Change-Id: I591748245af885eeb782df82eaa5f33e123f8e06
'}]
commit_message:
Extend the "configuring ironic-api behind mod_wsgi" guide

The etc/apache2/ironic configuration have the logs file path pointing to
/var/log/apache2/ which does not exist in the Red Hat systems (the
equivalent is /var/log/httpd). This patch extend the documentation to
point that out to the operator to look at these paths when setting up
the ironic-api to run behing Apache mod_wsgi.

Related-Bug: #1608252
Change-Id: I591748245af885eeb782df82eaa5f33e123f8e06

Ironic-python-agent has both supported ramdisks prebuilt and ready for
download, leaving no reason for building this in devstack in the general
case.

This also resolves (via alternative means) the bug which is causing our
deploy ramdisk to get built every time in the gate.

Change-Id: I00cf31bf75343fec4d7ec11178b3a253da806ac0
Related-bug: #1607981
'}]
commit_message:
Devstack should use a prebuilt ramdisk by default

Ironic-python-agent has both supported ramdisks prebuilt and ready for
download, leaving no reason for building this in devstack in the general
case.

This also resolves (via alternative means) the bug which is causing our
deploy ramdisk to get built every time in the gate.

Change-Id: I00cf31bf75343fec4d7ec11178b3a253da806ac0
Related-bug: #1607981

commit_message:
Render v3 compliant keystone config when needed

The charm currently fails to connect to keystone because it lacks
domain information. This change switches the aodh.conf template to
use the template fragment for keystone_authtoken which supports v2.0
and v3.

Change-Id: I421aa17ce7d1f3c5a3634ecee2310a3d351f65dd
(cherry picked from commit 12a3be020492bea214e5055b3bd196da06387cee)

When create a new loadbalancer, if o-cw is down, due to o-api use cast
to send rpc request, the loadbalancer will stay in PENDING_CREATE
status forever.

Add a timeout config, and do checks in house_keeping.

To be notice, the actual time for a load balancer will stay in
pending status can be vary between CONF.load_balancer_pending_timeout and
(CONF.load_balancer_pending_timeout + CONF.house_keeping.pending_loadbalancer_check_interval + pending_lb_thread run time)

Also, fix the 'Sql Alchemy' to 'SQLAlchemy'.

Closes-Bug: #1496646
Closes-Bug: #1567463
DocImpact

Change-Id: I4eb8d0d9c086af3fad76b12cfd227c6af27dc47a
"}]
commit_message:
Add a timeout config

When create a new loadbalancer, if o-cw is down, due to o-api use cast
to send rpc request, the loadbalancer will stay in PENDING_CREATE
status forever.

Add a timeout config, and do checks in house_keeping.

To be notice, the actual time for a load balancer will stay in
pending status can be vary between CONF.load_balancer_pending_timeout and
(CONF.load_balancer_pending_timeout + CONF.house_keeping.pending_loadbalancer_check_interval + pending_lb_thread run time)

Also, fix the 'Sql Alchemy' to 'SQLAlchemy'.

Closes-Bug: #1496646
Closes-Bug: #1567463
DocImpact

Change-Id: I4eb8d0d9c086af3fad76b12cfd227c6af27dc47a

commit_message:
Make fernet support trust auth against v2.0

When the fernet provider was original written,
it didn't support validating trust scoped tokens
against the v2.0 API. This was inconsistent with
the UUID provider.

This commit introduces that functionality to the Fernet provider.

Change-Id: Ia54b9c182dd5935a33c04751e268207443647242

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 15:43:16.000000000', 'files': ['templates/requirements_constraints.txt.j2', 'tests/test-repo-build.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': 'Correct global_pins depth

In https://review.openstack.org/350352 the repo_build process

commit_message:
Correct global_pins depth

In https://review.openstack.org/350352 the repo_build process
implemented the test vars and changes to the constraints build
which caters properly for global pins, but the data set used
was incorrectly mapped from the py_pkgs lookup output.

This patch fixes the depth, tests and template to use the
correct depth.

Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056
Change-Id: Ic8959fd27b4012d569aef1b9ddd1d7be40ed49e0

subject: Improve coverage in guestagent and backup models
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-29 16:29:47.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/backup/test_backup_models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_agent_heartbeats_models.py'], 'message': 'Improve coverage in guestagent and backup models

Coverage improvement overview:
    trove/backup/models.py 88% -> 99%
    trove/guestagent/models.py 93% -> 100%

trove/backup/models.py cases covered:
    Backup.validate_can_perform_action:
        * raise exception.DatastoreOperationNotSupported

    Backup.create:
        * raise exception.ClusterInstanceOperationNotSupported
        * raise exception.BackupCreationError

    Backup.verify_swift_auth_token:
        * raise exception.SwiftAuthError
        * raise exception.SwiftNotFound

    DBBackup.filename:
        * raise ValueError

    DBBackup.check_swift_object_exist:
        * raise exception.RestoreBackupIntegrityError
        * except ClientException as e:
             return False
             raise exception.SwiftAuthError

trove/guestagent/models.py cases covered:
    AgentHeartBeat.create:
        * raise exception.InvalidModelError

    AgentHeartBeat.save:
        * raise exception.InvalidModelError

Change-Id: I9ca867b66f96ae1d4aa257342d96e043b9058e5d
'}]
commit_message:
Improve coverage in guestagent and backup models

Coverage improvement overview:
    trove/backup/models.py 88% -> 99%
    trove/guestagent/models.py 93% -> 100%

trove/backup/models.py cases covered:
    Backup.validate_can_perform_action:
        * raise exception.DatastoreOperationNotSupported

    Backup.create:
        * raise exception.ClusterInstanceOperationNotSupported
        * raise exception.BackupCreationError

    Backup.verify_swift_auth_token:
        * raise exception.SwiftAuthError
        * raise exception.SwiftNotFound

    DBBackup.filename:
        * raise ValueError

    DBBackup.check_swift_object_exist:
        * raise exception.RestoreBackupIntegrityError
        * except ClientException as e:
             return False
             raise exception.SwiftAuthError

trove/guestagent/models.py cases covered:
    AgentHeartBeat.create:
        * raise exception.InvalidModelError

    AgentHeartBeat.save:
        * raise exception.InvalidModelError

Change-Id: I9ca867b66f96ae1d4aa257342d96e043b9058e5d

subject: Ophaned Volume Not Removed on Instance Delete
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-30 15:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['trove/taskmanager/models.py'], 'message': 'Ophaned Volume Not Removed on Instance Delete

When an instance is created with quota issues, the cinder volume is
created butthe nova instance fails to be created. Deleting the
instance would fail todelete the volume. Check the status of the
volume when deleting the instance, if the status of the volume is
"available" delete the volume as it is not connected to any instance.

Change-Id: Ie921a8ff2851e2d9d76a3c3836945c750f090c4e
Closes-Bug: #1344113
'}]
commit_message:
Ophaned Volume Not Removed on Instance Delete

When an instance is created with quota issues, the cinder volume is
created butthe nova instance fails to be created. Deleting the
instance would fail todelete the volume. Check the status of the
volume when deleting the instance, if the status of the volume is
"available" delete the volume as it is not connected to any instance.

Change-Id: Ie921a8ff2851e2d9d76a3c3836945c750f090c4e
Closes-Bug: #1344113

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-08-03 09:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Remove some unnecessary mocking in test_driver

Calls to _fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk already do nothing if kernel
and ramdisk are not defined. Their function is tested elsewhere.

_create_images_and_backing_files was being mocked where it wasn't
being used.

It's not necessary to mock configdrive.required_by when you can set
config_drive on the instance.

Change-Id: I6769ceefc10f075f2ae7629d9f7e8017974cb5b5
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Remove some unnecessary mocking in test_driver

Calls to _fetch_instance_kernel_ramdisk already do nothing if kernel
and ramdisk are not defined. Their function is tested elsewhere.

_create_images_and_backing_files was being mocked where it wasn't
being used.

It's not necessary to mock configdrive.required_by when you can set
config_drive on the instance.

Change-Id: I6769ceefc10f075f2ae7629d9f7e8017974cb5b5

commit_message:
q-l3 failed to start in case q-fwaas enabled

In case q-fwaas is enabled. It will causes the q-l3 failed to start
because the DevStack gave a redundant --config-file option to start q-l3

This is a follow-up patch of 84409516d56417464dfe0c4e6904a1a76f9fa254
to remove fwaas from DevStack completely.

Change-Id: I630969b3556bcffba506cab02a09cc83f4430c88
Closes-Bug: #1608401

commit_message:
objects: forbid updates for project_id field for subnets

API forbids it, and there should probably be no use case to allow
updating the field from inside neutron.

Change-Id: Ie661ed11cf14edf328eb3f104ae410e4bf2e352d
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
libvirt: Reset can_fallocate in test setUp()

imagebackend.Image stores global data in Image.can_fallocate. This is
normally irrelevant, but can cause the test_prealloc_image tests
to fail non-deterministically depending on test order.

Change-Id: I21e666de66b39130d98c6126a4e0c0b9932d7286

subject: libvirt: Create console.log consistently
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2506, 'name': 'devdatta-kulkarni', 'email': 'kulkarni.devdatta@gmail.com', 'username': 'devdatta-kulkarni'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12712, 'name': 'Gleb Stepanov', 'email': 'gstepanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'stgleb'}, {'_account_id': 13915, 'name': 'Silvan Kaiser', 'email': 'silvan@quobyte.com', 'username': 'kaisers'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 09:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Create console.log consistently

Change Ia84579b8 originally removed creation of console.log by Nova,
but this was found to break Quobyte CI (bug 1597644), and the change
was reverted. _create_image continues to be the wrong place for this
code, however, as it is not related to the creation of instance disks,
only the initialisation of a new instance directory. Note that this
does not correlate 1-1 with callers of _create_image: it is not
required by rescue(), as console.log will already exist.

The old code used a different method to create console.log for live
migration. We clean this up to have a single helper function.

The old code chowned console.log in the rescue case, which was never
required as the log is chowned immediately before use in
get_console_output(). It is not required in the Quobyte CI case
either, as libvirt has been configured with dynamic_ownership=0, so it
has not been chowned since creation. As
_chown_console_log_for_instance() has only 1 remaining caller, it is
inlined in get_console_output(), which also removes some duplication.

Note that I am not personally convinced that the Quobyte CI usage is
valid or correct, but I'm happy to not break it in the way we
currently know about while that determination is made. In the
meantime, I still need to move the console.log manipulation code out
of the way to refactor _create_image().

Change-Id: Iecf543b3cbf83df6c4a6ad17ce805979198556c8

commit_message:
libvirt: Create console.log consistently

Change Ia84579b8 originally removed creation of console.log by Nova,
but this was found to break Quobyte CI (bug 1597644), and the change
was reverted. _create_image continues to be the wrong place for this
code, however, as it is not related to the creation of instance disks,
only the initialisation of a new instance directory. Note that this
does not correlate 1-1 with callers of _create_image: it is not
required by rescue(), as console.log will already exist.

The old code used a different method to create console.log for live
migration. We clean this up to have a single helper function.

The old code chowned console.log in the rescue case, which was never
required as the log is chowned immediately before use in
get_console_output(). It is not required in the Quobyte CI case
either, as libvirt has been configured with dynamic_ownership=0, so it
has not been chowned since creation. As
_chown_console_log_for_instance() has only 1 remaining caller, it is
inlined in get_console_output(), which also removes some duplication.

Note that I am not personally convinced that the Quobyte CI usage is
valid or correct, but I'm happy to not break it in the way we
currently know about while that determination is made. In the
meantime, I still need to move the console.log manipulation code out
of the way to refactor _create_image().

Change-Id: Iecf543b3cbf83df6c4a6ad17ce805979198556c8

commit_message:
Don't load DNS integration in l3_router_plugin

In this patchset we stop the l3_router_plugin from loading the DNS integration
extension. The DNS integration extension should only be configured by the
operator by adding 'dns' to the 'extension_driver' list in ml2_conf.ini

Change-Id: I1321d9821973fe918005a8c2f3dd751af9affe38
Closes-Bug: #1574694
(cherry picked from commit 56962922cc439409bcecd808a1e9bbec2c3756f7)

commit_message:
Remove Tegile volume driver

The Tegile CI has not reported on a patch since 2016-06-09 03:29:06.
This is well past our policy for CI reporting.

Per Cinder's non-compliance policy [1] this patch removes the driver
and will be approved if the issue is not corrected within one week.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cinder/tested-3rdParty-drivers#Non-Compliance_Policy

Change-Id: If45461c4eff11e42ed65d2eb87573ab681c5ac93

commit_message:
Check for usage of same Cephx ID as manila service

There is an issue that happens when access is granted to a manila share
using the same Cephx ID that Manila uses when it is communicating with
the Ceph backend (e.g. the identity specified by the cephfs_auth_id
configuration option). When a request is made to revoke access to the
share with that Cephx ID, the share will become stuck in the
"deleting" state.

This commit adds logic to the _allow_access method in the CephFS Native
driver that checks to see if the Cephx ID given is the same that Manila
is using for its communication with the Ceph backend. If that is the
case, the creation of the access rule will fail with an error.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ida89b0061db1c8780a19475510b830d013a5c154
Closes-Bug: #1608592

commit_message:
Removes FuzzRequest from Syntribos

- This removes FuzzRequest as a type of RequestObject. All requests are
  now RequestObjects, and are parsed by the
  syntribos.clients.http.parser
- Fuzzing a request is now done via
  syntribos.tests.fuzz.datagen.fuzz_request()
- Moved _remove_attr_names and _remove_braces to the RequestObject
- Added unittests for fuzz datagen, http client models

Change-Id: Ib589c34ad80da58daab875d7383210d22d82d764

Behaviors of quotas cleanup should be different in case of existing users and
new ones(created by users context).

In case of existing users, we should not delete quotas, since we should not
change user pre-defined data.
In case of new users, we can't do the same as with existing users. Restore
default quotas means that services databases will continue storing quotas even
after tenant removement. So we need to remove quotas in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1595578

Change-Id: I6d42942f7fcdc67f221dc737495663eec065c8e4
"}]
commit_message:
[existing users] Restore original quotas

Behaviors of quotas cleanup should be different in case of existing users and
new ones(created by users context).

In case of existing users, we should not delete quotas, since we should not
change user pre-defined data.
In case of new users, we can't do the same as with existing users. Restore
default quotas means that services databases will continue storing quotas even
after tenant removement. So we need to remove quotas in this case.

Closes-Bug: #1595578

Change-Id: I6d42942f7fcdc67f221dc737495663eec065c8e4

commit_message:
Add min filter to Jinja2

Ansible-Jinja2 includes min filter,
but pure Jinja2 doesn't include it.

This fix adds min filter.

Change-Id: Ia28bf3a78fda660a30c232456403c6a208c7752a
Closes-Bug: #1607138

The wait_app function uses juju status a bit noisly when determining

commit_message:
Tidy use of status_set

The wait_app function uses juju status a bit noisly when determining
whether RabbitMQ is running or not; refactor to use log instead,
and only use status when RabbitMQ is not running when it should be.

Change-Id: I796bbec943008ae7512ddef6c54c0c9df032db3b

commit_message:
Adds support for  notification plugins in monacaapi

This review
  1) Removes the hard coded notification types
  2) Adds a new Rest API to get the notification types

Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin
Change-Id: Ie043533974f9dcf60c77093c5d6df5eced99e68b

commit_message:
Not authorized when logout and creating instance

Add TOKEN_DELETE_DISABLED to the settings so when can customize
the revocation of tokens on user logout or switch. This solves an
issue when a user launches a long running operation and then logs off
resulting in an error if the operation tries to validate the token

Change-Id: Ic693c563e028081d87b6447b95ac94608da2dafb
Closes-Bug: 1599870

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-03 02:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings.odl', 'devstack/entry_points'], 'message': "pseudo agent, devstack: hostconf_uri is set to ''

With devstack, hostconf_uri is set to '' (empty string) due to typo.
- Fix typo ODL_RESTCONF_URI -> ODL_HOSTCONF_URI, and
- don't set hostconf_uri when the variable is empty.
  Leave it to networking-odl for default value.

Closes-Bug: #1608651
Change-Id: Ic38916d9383da042bcb7f40b3e2a861f11504fda
"}]
commit_message:
pseudo agent, devstack: hostconf_uri is set to ''

With devstack, hostconf_uri is set to '' (empty string) due to typo.
- Fix typo ODL_RESTCONF_URI -> ODL_HOSTCONF_URI, and
- don't set hostconf_uri when the variable is empty.
  Leave it to networking-odl for default value.

Closes-Bug: #1608651
Change-Id: Ic38916d9383da042bcb7f40b3e2a861f11504fda

subject: Add the new DreamCompute cloud
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 14:45:36.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/vendors/dreamhost.json', 'os_client_config/vendors/dreamcompute.json', 'doc/source/vendor-support.rst'], 'message': "Add the new DreamCompute cloud

It does things the happy way - direct routing of IPv4 and IPv6. However,
it's a respin, so we're naming it dreamcompute rather than dreamhost so
that users don't get broken by the shift.

Remove dreamhost from the docs - people looking at documentation should
be using the new region.

Change-Id: I92eb38635c4389d2e9326fab038137a673497fa8
"}]
commit_message:
Add the new DreamCompute cloud

It does things the happy way - direct routing of IPv4 and IPv6. However,
it's a respin, so we're naming it dreamcompute rather than dreamhost so
that users don't get broken by the shift.

Remove dreamhost from the docs - people looking at documentation should
be using the new region.

Change-Id: I92eb38635c4389d2e9326fab038137a673497fa8

subject: [Verify] New command to uninstall Tempest plugins
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-02 21:07:27.000000000', 'files': ['rally/api.py', 'tests/unit/test_api.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/tempest.py', 'tests/unit/verification/test_tempest.py', 'rally/cli/commands/verify.py', 'etc/rally.bash_completion', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_verify.py'], 'message': "[Verify] New command to uninstall Tempest plugins

This command allows us to uninstall a Tempest plugin.

E.g.
  $ rally verify uninstallplugin --repo-name hello-world-tempest-plugin

Also, the patch has the following changes:
1. Now Tempest is installed in the local env (without deps) when providing
   the --sistem-wide argument. It is needed to list plugins installed in the
   local env, not in Tempest virtual env.
2. Now plugins are installed in the 'plugins/system-wide' directory when
   providing the --system-wide argument. It is needed to separate plugins
   installed in the local env and in Tempest virtual env.

Change-Id: Ic30a2705edb321a8d5af70e9d2bf5d5d5d9e8781
"}]
commit_message:
[Verify] New command to uninstall Tempest plugins

This command allows us to uninstall a Tempest plugin.

E.g.
  $ rally verify uninstallplugin --repo-name hello-world-tempest-plugin

Also, the patch has the following changes:
1. Now Tempest is installed in the local env (without deps) when providing
   the --sistem-wide argument. It is needed to list plugins installed in the
   local env, not in Tempest virtual env.
2. Now plugins are installed in the 'plugins/system-wide' directory when
   providing the --system-wide argument. It is needed to separate plugins
   installed in the local env and in Tempest virtual env.

Change-Id: Ic30a2705edb321a8d5af70e9d2bf5d5d5d9e8781

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-14 17:06:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/item_allocator.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_dvr_local_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_item_allocator.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Fix ItemAllocator class to handle exceptions

The ItemAllocator class blindly reads from a file
when initialized, assuming each line is always in
"key,value" syntax.  It's possible that the file
may become corrupted, leading to ValueErrors being
thrown which it doesn't handle.

This was found running the unit tests, more specifically
those doing DVR FIP namespace operations, since they were
always reading/writing the same files in /tmp.  Typically
the failure was random and would go away with a recheck,
but could be the cause of check job instability.  All
occurrences were fixed to use a test-created temporary
directory to avoid collision with each other.

Change-Id: I39d116aa8261b50bfcb3269416c1a307cafa134e
Closes-bug: #1602794
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Fix ItemAllocator class to handle exceptions

The ItemAllocator class blindly reads from a file
when initialized, assuming each line is always in
"key,value" syntax.  It's possible that the file
may become corrupted, leading to ValueErrors being
thrown which it doesn't handle.

This was found running the unit tests, more specifically
those doing DVR FIP namespace operations, since they were
always reading/writing the same files in /tmp.  Typically
the failure was random and would go away with a recheck,
but could be the cause of check job instability.  All
occurrences were fixed to use a test-created temporary
directory to avoid collision with each other.

Change-Id: I39d116aa8261b50bfcb3269416c1a307cafa134e
Closes-bug: #1602794

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:38:30.000000000', 'files': ['manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'manila/share/access.py'], 'message': 'Fix update_access race condition and stale data

In mitaka, update_access merged with a known concurrency issue.
This concurrency has been randomly failing in our CIs. This change
adds a lock mechanism to prevent that, while rules are being removed
by a thread, a parallel thread adds back or handle the same rules
that are being removed.

Also, a late mitaka update_access patch [1] broke share migration access rules
consistency, thus leaving stale access rule data on share server that hosted
the share prior to its migration. This patch addresses this by preventing the
refresh mechanism from adding back rules that are removed.

[1]: Change I0f863cbae4d8af0660114161deda7bf7aa60d71d

Change-Id: Id81def9bad80426fd5e08e1162366dabb3e6d1d8
Closes-bug: #1609414
Closes-bug: #1566815
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update_access race condition and stale data

In mitaka, update_access merged with a known concurrency issue.
This concurrency has been randomly failing in our CIs. This change
adds a lock mechanism to prevent that, while rules are being removed
by a thread, a parallel thread adds back or handle the same rules
that are being removed.

Also, a late mitaka update_access patch [1] broke share migration access rules
consistency, thus leaving stale access rule data on share server that hosted
the share prior to its migration. This patch addresses this by preventing the
refresh mechanism from adding back rules that are removed.

[1]: Change I0f863cbae4d8af0660114161deda7bf7aa60d71d

Change-Id: Id81def9bad80426fd5e08e1162366dabb3e6d1d8
Closes-bug: #1609414
Closes-bug: #1566815

commit_message:
libvirt: release serial console ports when destroying guests

The part of code responsible to release serial ports does not cover
all the cases. This commit moves that part inside the method _destroy
which is responsible for destroying the guest from a libvirt
perspective which is when we want to release ports.

(cherry picked from commit 95da4e87881424524c8ddda6a546764d43eb755e)

Change-Id: I24f2a1fa3b7ef3f2a3196f3689e5f2ba7d49bd87
Closes-Bug: #1489853

subject: Support flavor ids with leading '0'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 22:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/flavor/__init__.py', 'trove/flavor/views.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/flavor/test_flavor_views.py'], 'message': "Support flavor ids with leading '0'

When Trove moved to support alphanumeric flavor ids, the case of having
a numeric string id with leading zeros was not taken into account.
On the server side the code checks if the flavor id can be converted
to an int, and if so then sets it as such - the manifestation being
that if the str_id is '01' then the id will be set to '1' instead
of None as it should be.

This behavior has been fixed and unit tests created.

Change-Id: I87a8ac98d4358b75182c987f584c6098398a0c2a
Depends-On: I5acdec576a2e7da6cbfbb1cfc61c49fbbf7379af
Closes-Bug: #1603187
"}]
commit_message:
Support flavor ids with leading '0'

When Trove moved to support alphanumeric flavor ids, the case of having
a numeric string id with leading zeros was not taken into account.
On the server side the code checks if the flavor id can be converted
to an int, and if so then sets it as such - the manifestation being
that if the str_id is '01' then the id will be set to '1' instead
of None as it should be.

This behavior has been fixed and unit tests created.

Change-Id: I87a8ac98d4358b75182c987f584c6098398a0c2a
Depends-On: I5acdec576a2e7da6cbfbb1cfc61c49fbbf7379af
Closes-Bug: #1603187

subject: Support flavor ids with leading '0'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 22:33:29.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/utils.py', 'troveclient/tests/test_v1_shell.py', 'troveclient/v1/shell.py', 'troveclient/tests/fakes.py'], 'message': "Support flavor ids with leading '0'

When Trove moved to support alphanumeric flavor ids, the case of having
a numeric string id with leading zeros was not taken into account. The
behavior on the client side is to see if the id is all digits, and if so
it is converted to an int. That means that a flavor of '01' will be
incorrectly interpreted as '1'.

This behavior has been fixed and unit tests created.

Change-Id: I5acdec576a2e7da6cbfbb1cfc61c49fbbf7379af
Partial-Bug: #1603187
"}]
commit_message:
Support flavor ids with leading '0'

When Trove moved to support alphanumeric flavor ids, the case of having
a numeric string id with leading zeros was not taken into account. The
behavior on the client side is to see if the id is all digits, and if so
it is converted to an int. That means that a flavor of '01' will be
incorrectly interpreted as '1'.

This behavior has been fixed and unit tests created.

Change-Id: I5acdec576a2e7da6cbfbb1cfc61c49fbbf7379af
Partial-Bug: #1603187

commit_message:
Sign all tarballs and wheels

Now that the tarball signing job has been proven to work for the
bindep 2.0.1 release, use it for all releases and pre-releases that
run our {name}-tarball job.

This reverts commit 1a2539a225dd4962177f596062ec9c8d794402c1 and
part of commit 63b56462bc4354a94e52f8bcf05374c984cc175a.

Change-Id: I4e8564df4ec2146e6a13ffc0fc4f582b6f383f9c

subject: [Temp] Change update_user tests for v2 to skip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 16:11:01.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v2/test_users_negative.py'], 'message': '[Temp] Change update_user tests for v2 to skip

There is a current patch fix to add JSON schema validation to the v2.0
user_create and user_update API calls in Keystone. Before schema
validation, the Keystone backend would throw either an
Unauthorized and/or Forbidden when an invalid request was sent.

With the schema validation in place, an invalid request is caught earlier
and a Bad Request is thrown back instead. This causes the two tests
skipped in this patch to fail.

This patch fix is to temporarily skip the two failing tests while the fix
is pushed in keystone, then there will be another fix here
to add a value in the request of the skipped tests to correctly
cause Keystone to throw the expected error. It would also be good
to add another test that does pass an empty request and expects
a Bad Request exception.

Keystone Patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345022/

Change-Id: Ic6da221994862a32b183e8d8f5d851b78cc1695c
'}]
commit_message:
[Temp] Change update_user tests for v2 to skip

There is a current patch fix to add JSON schema validation to the v2.0
user_create and user_update API calls in Keystone. Before schema
validation, the Keystone backend would throw either an
Unauthorized and/or Forbidden when an invalid request was sent.

With the schema validation in place, an invalid request is caught earlier
and a Bad Request is thrown back instead. This causes the two tests
skipped in this patch to fail.

This patch fix is to temporarily skip the two failing tests while the fix
is pushed in keystone, then there will be another fix here
to add a value in the request of the skipped tests to correctly
cause Keystone to throw the expected error. It would also be good
to add another test that does pass an empty request and expects
a Bad Request exception.

Keystone Patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345022/

Change-Id: Ic6da221994862a32b183e8d8f5d851b78cc1695c

Export CLOUDS_YAML

Exporting this parameter will make it available in the post_test_hook
for integration tests that would like to read the configuration file
for their own integration test configuration.

commit_message:
[common] Use hyphens in filenames

Part of "consistency-file-rename" spec [1]

This commit also changes the following:
* Update corresponding references to common in various guides
* Rename excluded_patterns in conf.py of various guide
* Rename existing entries in www/static/.htaccess
* Add entries to .htaccess to redirect renamed files

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/docs-specs/specs/newton/consistency-file-rename.html

Change-Id: I39a9d5b95535cad1918ee64e95dee5ef18ab2cbe
