commit_message:
Print out specific filter that failed in object filtering unit test

This should help in debugging failures. Currently there is no way to
determine which filter failed without putting a breakpoint/printing the
variable.

Change-Id: Ie9bf3b29bc08d9706f1835ca687b90c5909e1610
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

subject: Go ahead and admit that we return Munch objects
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:17:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/coding.rst', 'shade/operatorcloud.py', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Go ahead and admit that we return Munch objects

There was a point in time in the past where we were gung ho on using
Munch as a halfway house to get us to pure dicts. However, we released
1.0 before we could do that, so we're pretty stuck with them for the
forseeable future. That's not terrible - they're pretty low overhead and
work pretty well.

Depends-On: Ie10099430481ffa76f5a19557e3693189544df6b
Change-Id: I8b7dd2c4038db999280ec0c2c9c43fb9499e6d22
"}]
commit_message:
Go ahead and admit that we return Munch objects

There was a point in time in the past where we were gung ho on using
Munch as a halfway house to get us to pure dicts. However, we released
1.0 before we could do that, so we're pretty stuck with them for the
forseeable future. That's not terrible - they're pretty low overhead and
work pretty well.

Depends-On: Ie10099430481ffa76f5a19557e3693189544df6b
Change-Id: I8b7dd2c4038db999280ec0c2c9c43fb9499e6d22

commit_message:
Depend on python-heatclient>=1.0.0

The event_utils.poll_for_events function is only available from 1.0.0.
There have been reports of the ansible os_stack module failing due to
a too-old python-heatclient.

Depends-On: Ie10099430481ffa76f5a19557e3693189544df6b
Change-Id: I0843c377409b71d808a7f096f2daa28c655add3c

commit_message:
Minor docstring and unittests fixes for IPMIConsole

This is the follow-up patch of the commit
857372a2269cdd0f8a1ae5b9e9f6e0ee193f01be. This fix follows
some minor comments of Lucas and Ruby from patch set 29 at the
review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293873/. The changes are:

* Fix the docstring of the _start_console() in ipmitool.py to reflect
  the real parameters being passed to the method.

* Fix few unittests to use self.assertFalse(<mock>.called) instead of
  self.assertFalse(<mock>.call_count)

Change-Id: I25caa9202c8bc867973205d2bf9642064d3ba492

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-03 09:18:20.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/base.py', 'other-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix python35 job failures

- Installation of the cryptography module fails on Ubuntu Xenial
  because the libssl-dev package needs to be installed first, so we
  add this to other-requirements.txt

- inspect.getargspec()` was deprecated in Python 3.0 and will be removed
  in 3.6 (ETA late 2016). From Python 3.5 it started throwing a deprecation
  warning which leds some tests failures.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic094ca5c636af9ac1e212914df910a020d92702d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix python35 job failures

- Installation of the cryptography module fails on Ubuntu Xenial
  because the libssl-dev package needs to be installed first, so we
  add this to other-requirements.txt

- inspect.getargspec()` was deprecated in Python 3.0 and will be removed
  in 3.6 (ETA late 2016). From Python 3.5 it started throwing a deprecation
  warning which leds some tests failures.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic094ca5c636af9ac1e212914df910a020d92702d

That test is not supposed to test the count of roles. It is about role

commit_message:
Correct test_implied_roles

That test is not supposed to test the count of roles. It is about role
inference rules. This change removes the pure role checks, as it is not
the main intent of the test.

This also fixes a related bug where this test is failing
intermittently. See the bug description for more details.

Change-Id: I8ea1b6d8f344296486427a1f9ebc31c58314501e
Closes-Bug: 1609398

subject: networking-midonet: Add periodic jobs for stable branches
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-01 00:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'networking-midonet: Add periodic jobs for stable branches

As stable branches have less activities than master,
breakages caused by changes in other repositories [1] are
sometimes left unnoticed for a while.  Have periodic jobs
to improve the situation.

[1] networking-midonet jobs have a relatively high number of
affecting projects.  neutron, neutron-*aas, networking-l2gw.

Closes-Bug: #1594662
Change-Id: I8652d26619965c0fac9a713ad04ed9f79cfc6e14
'}]
commit_message:
networking-midonet: Add periodic jobs for stable branches

As stable branches have less activities than master,
breakages caused by changes in other repositories [1] are
sometimes left unnoticed for a while.  Have periodic jobs
to improve the situation.

[1] networking-midonet jobs have a relatively high number of
affecting projects.  neutron, neutron-*aas, networking-l2gw.

Closes-Bug: #1594662
Change-Id: I8652d26619965c0fac9a713ad04ed9f79cfc6e14

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state The current method of installing the distribution packages required is set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 16:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-apt.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-state-36122c837427799f.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state
The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I2f363248340279efa60a8812010d762640588d73
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state
The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I2f363248340279efa60a8812010d762640588d73

commit_message:
Fix module import for ovs_vsctl_timeout option

The ovs_vsctl_timeout config options was recently refactored [1].
This refactoring broke networking-ovn because
neutron/agent/ovsdb/impl_idl.py uses the wrong module to register
the option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/346567/

commit_message:
Support 'conditions' section for templates

This changes:
1. Support 'Conditions' for AWSTemplateFormatVersion: 2010-09-09
2. Support 'conditions' for heat_template_version: 2016-10-14
3. There is no need to add a new HeatTemplateFormatVersion template,
   because we decide to support conditions in AWSTemplateFormatVersion
   and heat_template_version: 2016-10-14, so remove the
   HeatTemplateFormatVersion.2016-10-14
4. Move the definition of function 'equals' to hot/functions.py
5. Mark 'equals' as condition function which supported in conditions.

Change-Id: I2e7bdfa1c2052e75f35f2bd0003cdc170188d8b8
Blueprint: support-conditions-function

commit_message:
Enable Manila integration - as a composable controller service

Allows the installation and configuration of Manila.
Supports the generic driver only. This has a dependency on the
puppet-tripleo classes for manila where the puppet specific
config now lives.

The review at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315658/ has been
merge into this one, as of v68, so manila lands as a composable
service. This was brought up on the mailing list at [1]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/096126.html

Co-Authored-By: Marios Andreou <marios@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint composable-services-within-roles
Depends-On: I444916d60a67bf730bf4089323dba1c1429e2e71
Depends-On: I9eda4b3364e5c59342761a1ec71b0eb567c69cf1
Depends-On: I571b65a5402c1028418476a573ebeb9450ed00c9
Change-Id: I7acebac4354fca1f8d7ff6c343c1346bf29b81c6

The charm currently fails to connect to keystone because it lacks

Change-Id: I421aa17ce7d1f3c5a3634ecee2310a3d351f65dd

commit_message:
Render v3 compliant keystone config when needed

The charm currently fails to connect to keystone because it lacks
domain information. This change switches the aodh.conf template to
use the template fragment for keystone_authtoken which supports v2.0
and v3.

Change-Id: I421aa17ce7d1f3c5a3634ecee2310a3d351f65dd

subject: Scrub storage-less VSCSI mappings in destroy
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 13557, 'name': 'Matt Rabe', 'email': 'mdrabe@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mdrabe'}, {'_account_id': 13562, 'name': 'Samuel Matzek', 'email': 'smatzek@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'smatzek'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 21:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py'], 'message': 'Scrub storage-less VSCSI mappings in destroy

In certain cases, like cleaning up evacuated instances, the volume
disconnection tasks in the destroy flow may fail because the backing
storage elements have been removed from the VIOS at the storage back
end, thus leaving the disconnect flow with no way of identifying the
relevant mappings by storage name/UDID.  In such cases, we still want to
delete the mappings; but we have to do so based purely on the LPAR ID.
This change set adds such logic to the destroy flow.

Closes-Bug: 1604980

Conflicts:
	nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py

Change-Id: I10d941a9e5d82532526de293259e4b44f0ed3ab6
'}]
commit_message:
Scrub storage-less VSCSI mappings in destroy

In certain cases, like cleaning up evacuated instances, the volume
disconnection tasks in the destroy flow may fail because the backing
storage elements have been removed from the VIOS at the storage back
end, thus leaving the disconnect flow with no way of identifying the
relevant mappings by storage name/UDID.  In such cases, we still want to
delete the mappings; but we have to do so based purely on the LPAR ID.
This change set adds such logic to the destroy flow.

Closes-Bug: 1604980

Conflicts:
	nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py

Change-Id: I10d941a9e5d82532526de293259e4b44f0ed3ab6

subject: Forbid eventlet hacking check
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-03 10:54:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/hacking/checks.py', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/hacking/test_checks.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Forbid eventlet hacking check

As per [1] we are not allowing eventlet based code in neutron-lib.
This patch adds a hacking check to ensure no eventlet based imports
are brought into neutron-lib. This check is added to the neutron-lib
internal checks as consumers are not likely to forbid eventlet yet.
UTs are also included.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333017/

Change-Id: I4a32093a0971750e07f89fff5a1d5c501cf20cdd
'}]
commit_message:
Forbid eventlet hacking check

As per [1] we are not allowing eventlet based code in neutron-lib.
This patch adds a hacking check to ensure no eventlet based imports
are brought into neutron-lib. This check is added to the neutron-lib
internal checks as consumers are not likely to forbid eventlet yet.
UTs are also included.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333017/

commit_message:
Fix multipath iSCSI encrypted volume attach failure

Currently iSCSI volume attachment fails if iscsi_use_multipath is
set to True. This is because the encryptor requests cryptsetup
to create the symlink to the LUKS device with the same name of
the device-mapper multipath device. To avoid the name collision,
this patch adds the 'crypt-' prefix to the symlink.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/volume/encryptors/test_cryptsetup.py

Change-Id: I01a3104025a9c479e40933ca24024355df9dfb8b
Closes-Bug: #1439869
(cherry picked from commit 89a61ab8f4602e018763afb173e1a862f151a222)
(cherry picked from commit 44afcd0b72b9bfc77c0bf2f36cfbc6af5cac6cc7)

commit_message:
Add SolidFire Monasca Check Plugin:

This adds a very basic plugin that monitors SolidFire storage clusters. The
plugin provides cluster fault and usage metrics. This uses a stripped down
version of the Cinder volume driver to provide connectivity to the cluster.

Change-Id: Ibd0d577b6bf45747a0daaec2c5c3479741ae0937

nova-compute and nova-libvirt containers

subject: Scrub storage-less VSCSI mappings in destroy
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 13557, 'name': 'Matt Rabe', 'email': 'mdrabe@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mdrabe'}, {'_account_id': 13562, 'name': 'Samuel Matzek', 'email': 'smatzek@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'smatzek'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 20:53:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py'], 'message': 'Scrub storage-less VSCSI mappings in destroy

In certain cases, like cleaning up evacuated instances, the volume
disconnection tasks in the destroy flow may fail because the backing
storage elements have been removed from the VIOS at the storage back
end, thus leaving the disconnect flow with no way of identifying the
relevant mappings by storage name/UDID.  In such cases, we still want to
delete the mappings; but we have to do so based purely on the LPAR ID.
This change set adds such logic to the destroy flow.

Change-Id: I10d941a9e5d82532526de293259e4b44f0ed3ab6
Closes-Bug: 1604980
'}]
commit_message:
Scrub storage-less VSCSI mappings in destroy

In certain cases, like cleaning up evacuated instances, the volume
disconnection tasks in the destroy flow may fail because the backing
storage elements have been removed from the VIOS at the storage back
end, thus leaving the disconnect flow with no way of identifying the
relevant mappings by storage name/UDID.  In such cases, we still want to
delete the mappings; but we have to do so based purely on the LPAR ID.
This change set adds such logic to the destroy flow.

Change-Id: I10d941a9e5d82532526de293259e4b44f0ed3ab6
Closes-Bug: 1604980

commit_message:
Rename compute manager _check_dev_name to _add_missing_dev_names

'check' is a misleading name for this function, as it modifies its
input.

We tweak the loop to be slightly more efficient and readable.

We also save the bdm after updating it. This may have previously been
a bug.

Change-Id: Idadb6192eff68c21cff3387147b98319b6203505

subject: Make domain config mutable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 14:37:55.000000000', 'files': ['src/lib/charm/openstack/designate.py', 'unit_tests/test_designate_handlers.py', 'src/templates/novarc', 'unit_tests/test_lib_charm_openstack_designate.py', 'src/reactive/designate_handlers.py'], 'message': 'Make domain config mutable

Previously domain config has been immutable. Meaning that it could
be amended or set for the first time post deployment. This change
fixes that. In the process some other enhancements were made.

* Create and use check_zone_ids contextmanager to detect if domain
  ids have changed. If they have then update peers via leadership db.
* Rendering all configs is now a two stage process.
  render_base_config is called first to ensure that the Designate API
  servce is up and configured as the sink configs query the designate
  API to retrieve the domain ids for the neutron and nova domains.
* designate_handlers.py has been simplified to reduce the number
  of handlers and stop gating on domains.created which previously
  made domain config options immutable.
* templates/novarc was hard coded to use http. this has been updated
  to set the protocol based on whats passed back from keystone.

Change-Id: I477ad22bf9131672f6521d6afbf6f16a01d8b112
(cherry picked from commit 4a9444a67339e6e170f54e998a57b83ecd9566e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Make domain config mutable

Previously domain config has been immutable. Meaning that it could
be amended or set for the first time post deployment. This change
fixes that. In the process some other enhancements were made.

* Create and use check_zone_ids contextmanager to detect if domain
  ids have changed. If they have then update peers via leadership db.
* Rendering all configs is now a two stage process.
  render_base_config is called first to ensure that the Designate API
  servce is up and configured as the sink configs query the designate
  API to retrieve the domain ids for the neutron and nova domains.
* designate_handlers.py has been simplified to reduce the number
  of handlers and stop gating on domains.created which previously
  made domain config options immutable.
* templates/novarc was hard coded to use http. this has been updated
  to set the protocol based on whats passed back from keystone.

Change-Id: I477ad22bf9131672f6521d6afbf6f16a01d8b112
(cherry picked from commit 4a9444a67339e6e170f54e998a57b83ecd9566e8)

commit_message:
Size in tintri driver should be converted to integer

In tintri driver the returning size of function manage_existing_get_size
is float, which should be converted to integer. This patch fixes it and
modifies the unittest case test_manage_existing_get_size.

Change-Id: Ibcb7d96766bd8bfb2bf188267c52fce30cd80597
Closes-Bug: #1588592

commit_message:
No more braces-style eslint errors

Running eslint is effectively useless nowdays because of the
overwhelming number of warnings returned.

This patch fixes the existing "braces-style" errors.

I've decided to only fix those errors here to keep the patch small, and
not destroy any chance of success by needing to rebase every 5 minutes.
Other fixes will be incoming.

Change-Id: I0cc2772287ce3f4b3ddb808764dd8d9b1c569d02
Partial-Bug: #1554824

commit_message:
Network validation in Manila

Added new validation checks. If client is using neutron,
manila expects both neutron net and neutron subnet properties
OR their absense. Nova network is only expected when neutron
is not used.

Change-Id: I7c259d7b2c9c4ed554bca89ef3d286c25716a33b

subject: update tag-release git command to fall back to master
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 18:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/functions'], 'message': 'update tag-release git command to fall back to master

The release tagging script relied on the zuul-cloner behavior of falling
back to master if the requested branch did not exist. Add logic to the
shell command replacement to do the same thing, with a warning.

I tested this locally on the Oslo releases today, and it worked. Before
the change release.sh failed because it could not check out the
stable/newton branch of openstack/requirements to submit the patch to
update the constraints list.

Change-Id: Ib29a68edbb5bfea64625128da35ddad61098dd9c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update tag-release git command to fall back to master

The release tagging script relied on the zuul-cloner behavior of falling
back to master if the requested branch did not exist. Add logic to the
shell command replacement to do the same thing, with a warning.

I tested this locally on the Oslo releases today, and it worked. Before
the change release.sh failed because it could not check out the
stable/newton branch of openstack/requirements to submit the patch to
update the constraints list.

Change-Id: Ib29a68edbb5bfea64625128da35ddad61098dd9c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix Gate HA test Failure
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-08-03 04:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['congress/common/config.py', 'congress/api/datasource_model.py', 'congress/tests/etc/congress.conf.test', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/tests2/api/test_datasource_model.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/dse2/dse_node.py', 'congress/tests2/api/base.py', 'congress/tests2/test_congress.py'], 'message': "Fix Gate HA test Failure

This commit fixes the HA issue happenning from time to time.
The problem is with explict call to create/delete datasource
policy in add_datasource/delete_datasource which is causing
the error, if synchronizer is run between the 2 statements.

So, in this commit removed the explicit call to create/delete
policies and let synchronizer take care of the same in next
periodic iteration.

Haven't added explicit call to synchronizer because of following-
1. In case of HA, even if explicit call to synchronizer added
will only run on one PE node and other nodes needs to be
synchronized later (or we need to broadcast the call) ,
and also if the synchronizer periodic task is running in
different thread, and making an explicit call again, might
cause race condition to happen.

Change-Id: I76e8c859104eaa5d966c9c146dcf0f6bec372d71
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Gate HA test Failure

This commit fixes the HA issue happenning from time to time.
The problem is with explict call to create/delete datasource
policy in add_datasource/delete_datasource which is causing
the error, if synchronizer is run between the 2 statements.

So, in this commit removed the explicit call to create/delete
policies and let synchronizer take care of the same in next
periodic iteration.

Haven't added explicit call to synchronizer because of following-
1. In case of HA, even if explicit call to synchronizer added
will only run on one PE node and other nodes needs to be
synchronized later (or we need to broadcast the call) ,
and also if the synchronizer periodic task is running in
different thread, and making an explicit call again, might
cause race condition to happen.

Change-Id: I76e8c859104eaa5d966c9c146dcf0f6bec372d71

'}]
commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the convenience

commit_message:
Add token feature support matrix to documentation

This introduces a feature support matrix to illustrate which of our
various token providers supports which API operations and features. This
is intended to mirror Nova's feature support matrix documentation page,
found here:

  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/support-matrix.html

After running `tox -e docs`, the result is embedded in
`doc/build/html/configuration.html`.

Change-Id: I3dc896a2906e25827a9e01afc7de5a737831c336

commit_message:
Refactor fix magic in get_one_cloud()

Extract the magic argument fixes from get_ne_cloud() so they can be
extended or modified.

Needed by OSC in order to maintain compatibility due to the much
earlier loading of auth plugins than before.  Have I mentioned
that really fouled things up for OSC?

Change-Id: I22cd890f9cbd605dcd615f82b3e65c58f52ff114

commit_message:
Add support for listing a cloud as shut down

We've had one vendor cloud go away in the past, and there is one
existing deprecated cloud currently. Add support for providing the
user with an informative error message in the case where they
attempt to use such a cloud.

Change-Id: I894e0c0a4786e60fce1238bb2883828e89d44b01

subject: Add support for deprecating cloud profiles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-09 09:26:39.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/defaults.json', 'os_client_config/vendor-schema.json'], 'message': "Add support for deprecating cloud profiles

We've had HP shut down their public cloud, and DreamHost has recent spun
up a new cloud with a different operational profile and auth_url that is
essentially a replacement cloud. That means people using the old
information need to do things, so we need to be able to communicate that
to them.

Add support for adding a deprecated status to a vendor profile, as well
as a verbose message explaining what the user may do to remediate.

Change-Id: I19b67d7cd71fba2d9da0e3a6adb2d229ead65396
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for deprecating cloud profiles

We've had HP shut down their public cloud, and DreamHost has recent spun
up a new cloud with a different operational profile and auth_url that is
essentially a replacement cloud. That means people using the old
information need to do things, so we need to be able to communicate that
to them.

Add support for adding a deprecated status to a vendor profile, as well
as a verbose message explaining what the user may do to remediate.

Change-Id: I19b67d7cd71fba2d9da0e3a6adb2d229ead65396

commit_message:
Documentation how validations work

Start importing the TripleO Ansible validations from Clapper repository
[1] into tripleo-validations.

This commit lays down the structure for the ansible validations and
documents how to write and run validations.

Next commits will import existing validations one by one.

[1] https://github.com/rthallisey/clapper

Change-Id: I946d4e61bda1382c5299c7494fb994d870cdc56b
Co-Authored-By: Tomas Sedovic <tsedovic@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Configure keystone authtoken options

In cinder::api, use keystone::resource::authtoken to configure
keystone_authtoken section in cinder.conf, with all parameters required
to configure keystonemiddleware.
This patch will allow to deploy Cinder to use Keystone v3
authentification.

Some deprecations:
cinder::api::auth_type is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_type instead.
cinder::api::identity_uri is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_url instead.
cinder::api::auth_uri is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri instead.
cinder::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::project_name instead.
cinder::api::keystone_user is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::username instead.
cinder::api::keystone_password is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::password instead.
cinder::api::memcached_servers is deprecated, use cinder::keystone::authtoken::memcached_servers instead.

Closes-Bug: #1604463
Change-Id: I64736457bd8527198a8a81ea784d3bf74284063b

commit_message:
Revert 372057bddb27716acd42a88591552a8dee7b519b

"Fix recordset changes so that they preserve object changes fields"

This patch caused updated that had an empty records array (i.e. not sent in the json request) to remove all records from a recordset.

http://logs.openstack.org/24/350024/1/check/gate-shade-dsvm-functional-nova/fe8727c/console.html#_2016-08-02_14_51_48_101643

This reverts commit 372057bddb27716acd42a88591552a8dee7b519b.

Change-Id: Ie10099430481ffa76f5a19557e3693189544df6b

commit_message:
Port device events for common agent

Some of the agent code may want to receive events whenever
a device is added/updated/deleted. Currently the only way
to do that is to modify the loop directly or create an
extension. Neither of these options are good if it's code
we don't want users to disable (the extensions) and it's
specific to one agent (so we don't want to modify the loop).

Partially-Implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I3468c7f46cc1b4000cdd537e8f216d207a14727a

commit_message:
[docs] Revise deployment configuration chapter

Reorganised content based on feedback and IA proposal in
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/osa-install-guide-IA:

1. Move affinity content to the appendix
2. Move security hardening configuration to the appendix
3. Create an advanced configuration section in the appendix
4. Delete configuring hosts and configuring target host networking information,
and create a configuration file examples section
5. Move glance configuration information to the developer docs
6. Move overridding configuration defaults to the appendix.
7. Move checking configuration file content to the installation chapter

Change-Id: I71efaf2472b1233f1b1a1367fcb00ca598d27ea9
Implements: blueprint osa-install-guide-overhaul

subject: Make pseudo tool handle plurals better
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 19:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pseudo.py'], 'message': "Make pseudo tool handle plurals better

Right now the pseudo tool creates an uncompilable po file
if a plural message has extra parameters in the plural form
that don't exist in the singular form.

Update the tool to base plural messages on the original plural
form so that the expected parameters will always be present.

Change-Id: I1910478136001720f97e1f531a03be28e185d99c
Closes-bug: 1563005
"}]
commit_message:
Make pseudo tool handle plurals better

Right now the pseudo tool creates an uncompilable po file
if a plural message has extra parameters in the plural form
that don't exist in the singular form.

Update the tool to base plural messages on the original plural
form so that the expected parameters will always be present.

Change-Id: I1910478136001720f97e1f531a03be28e185d99c
Closes-bug: 1563005

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 08:14:15.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ie5e69a7e67aa0ed094f09e44a2659501d99cf667
Closes-bug: #1604734
'}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ie5e69a7e67aa0ed094f09e44a2659501d99cf667
Closes-bug: #1604734

subject: Hide access and security panel if no nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 14:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/panel.py'], 'message': "Hide access and security panel if no nova

If nova isn't available in a region, Horizon will
show an error page/failure in the access and
security panel. Although there are other panels that
don't work without nova, they just show a proper
error message.

Update the panel definiton so that access and security
is shown only when nova is available.

Change-Id: Ie292dc97a4e80b86cd52c66b28b1fd467e303067
Closes-bug: 1498403
"}]
commit_message:
Hide access and security panel if no nova

If nova isn't available in a region, Horizon will
show an error page/failure in the access and
security panel. Although there are other panels that
don't work without nova, they just show a proper
error message.

Update the panel definiton so that access and security
is shown only when nova is available.

Change-Id: Ie292dc97a4e80b86cd52c66b28b1fd467e303067
Closes-bug: 1498403

While creating a snapshot of an instance, if you give a name which is
less than 256 characters, but more than 256 bytes, glance gives the
correct error-> "Image name too long" but it doesn't propagate to the
horizon. So, this patch fixes this issue.

Closes-bug: #1412882

commit_message:
Fixes Error message during instance snapshot creation.

While creating a snapshot of an instance, if you give a name which is
less than 256 characters, but more than 256 bytes, glance gives the
correct error-> "Image name too long" but it doesn't propagate to the
horizon. So, this patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I50d8a27c2545e802482e5ac6c80eb45a659cd312
Closes-bug: #1412882

While there is only one flavor in instance resize form, it

instance, the patch fix it.

steps to reproduce:

1. demo user only can access the two flavors(m1.tiny and m1.small)
2. launch instance001 with flavor m1.tiny
3. try to resize instance001, the horizon will raise "'Flavor' object is not iterable"

Change-Id: I05915be8b7e8b8d528332968c67c0223ca8db35c
Closes-Bug: #1506488

commit_message:
The flavors in resize workflow should be form choice format

While there is only one flavor in instance resize form, it
will raise `'Flavor' object is not iterable` while resize
instance, the patch fix it.

steps to reproduce:

1. demo user only can access the two flavors(m1.tiny and m1.small)
2. launch instance001 with flavor m1.tiny
3. try to resize instance001, the horizon will raise "'Flavor' object is not iterable"

Change-Id: I05915be8b7e8b8d528332968c67c0223ca8db35c
Closes-Bug: #1506488

subject: Don't assume an eth1
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 11:34:41.000000000', 'files': ['toci_instack_osinfra.sh'], 'message': "Don't assume an eth1

Not all cloud providers (osic and ovh in particular) spawn instances
with an eth0 and eth1, so don't assume an eth1 exists when finding it's
ip address to add to $no_proxy.

This recently started failing when we merged:
I2b84b3dfae60bbe7d6a76259b1d718b7dda08739

which added set -o pipefail to toci_instack_osinfra.sh and passed CI
when it ran on a different provider (rax).

Change-Id: I601a5e09eafbc1f03d7913ca6ffc060e3d774a44
Closes-Bug: #1609357
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume an eth1

Not all cloud providers (osic and ovh in particular) spawn instances
with an eth0 and eth1, so don't assume an eth1 exists when finding it's
ip address to add to $no_proxy.

This recently started failing when we merged:
I2b84b3dfae60bbe7d6a76259b1d718b7dda08739

which added set -o pipefail to toci_instack_osinfra.sh and passed CI
when it ran on a different provider (rax).

Change-Id: I601a5e09eafbc1f03d7913ca6ffc060e3d774a44
Closes-Bug: #1609357

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-09 14:07:28.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/base.py'], 'message': 'Policy should support AND and OR checks for panels

Allowing for more complex combinations of policy checks.
Will check for logical OR of all top level permissions.
Will use logical AND for all first level tuples (check
that use has all the  permissions in the tuple list)

Examples:
T = Policy Rule Tuple.

Checks for ALL required permissions
([T1, T2, T3],) => T1 AND T2 AND T3

Checks for T1 OR (T2 AND T3)
(T1, [T2, T3],) => T1 OR (T2 AND T3)

Change-Id: I86e95cc9a22d7ef68ddaf37cfc5f36884cc7c35d
Closes-Bug: #1426415
'}]
commit_message:
Policy should support AND and OR checks for panels

Allowing for more complex combinations of policy checks.
Will check for logical OR of all top level permissions.
Will use logical AND for all first level tuples (check
that use has all the  permissions in the tuple list)

Examples:
T = Policy Rule Tuple.

Checks for ALL required permissions
([T1, T2, T3],) => T1 AND T2 AND T3

Checks for T1 OR (T2 AND T3)
(T1, [T2, T3],) => T1 OR (T2 AND T3)

Change-Id: I86e95cc9a22d7ef68ddaf37cfc5f36884cc7c35d
Closes-Bug: #1426415

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 10419, 'name': 'Ryan Hallisey', 'email': 'rhallise@redhat.com', 'username': 'rhallisey'}, {'_account_id': 16233, 'name': 'Mauricio Lima', 'email': 'mauriciolimab@gmail.com', 'username': 'limamauricio'}, {'_account_id': 16620, 'name': 'Alicja Kwasniewska', 'email': 'alicja.kwasniewska@intel.com', 'username': 'akwasnie'}, {'_account_id': 21996, 'name': 'Ken Wronkiewicz', 'email': 'wh-openstack@wirewd.com', 'username': 'bowtie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-02 20:41:48.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/glance/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-registry.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Glance interface address, memcached override, and glance override.

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address, memcached pools, and glance registry
host so that Kubernetes can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"

Two tings to note:
 * This depends on a kolla-kubernetes patch, so that it won't be merged
   until it's safe for glance to bind to 0.0.0.0.  It's OK to bind to
   0.0.0.0 in the Kubernetes world because the network fabric controls
   access.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic87566118a1d4f552748392ff394b9b121c91887
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
Depends-On: I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0
'}]
commit_message:
Glance interface address, memcached override, and glance override.

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address, memcached pools, and glance registry
host so that Kubernetes can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
glance_registry_host: "glance-registry"

Two tings to note:
 * This depends on a kolla-kubernetes patch, so that it won't be merged
   until it's safe for glance to bind to 0.0.0.0.  It's OK to bind to
   0.0.0.0 in the Kubernetes world because the network fabric controls
   access.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic87566118a1d4f552748392ff394b9b121c91887
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
Depends-On: I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-08-02 20:41:48.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon/templates/horizon.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/horizon/templates/local_settings.j2', 'ansible/roles/keystone/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Horizon interface address and memcached override

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address and memcached pools, so that Kubernetes
can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"

Three tings to note:
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the service is not using net=host, so a
   0.0.0.0 interface address is totally OK.  That patch has been merged.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.
 * In order to not duplicate tons of code, moved the keystone_admin_url /
   keystone_internal_url / keystone_public_url to the common defaults
   from the keystone defaults.

Co-Authored-By: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I586ce1c6c3300254c4e2a398ff46645df576aeb0
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon interface address and memcached override

Note: This should not result in any behavior changes in regular Kolla, just
Kolla-Kubernetes and only when you've overridden stuff in globals.yml

Allows override of interface address and memcached pools, so that Kubernetes
can do the right thing.

There are some significant architectural issues involved in memcached pooling
in the Kolla-kubernetes world.  Avoiding them right now.

Current working with this Kolla-Kubernetes globals.yml file:

api_interface_address: "0.0.0.0"

memcached_servers: "memcached"

keystone_database_address: "mariadb"
keystone_admin_url: "http://keystone-admin:35357/v3"
keystone_internal_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"
keystone_public_url: "http://keystone-public:5000/v3"

Three tings to note:
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the service is not using net=host, so a
   0.0.0.0 interface address is totally OK.  That patch has been merged.
 * In Kolla-Kubernetes, the global.yml file doesn't do var substitution
   so you have to be explicit about the URLs, otherwise Keystone will
   look like it was provisioned but it won't quite be provisioned right.
 * In order to not duplicate tons of code, moved the keystone_admin_url /
   keystone_internal_url / keystone_public_url to the common defaults
   from the keystone defaults.

commit_message:
Fix uuid to UUID in expected error messages

This commit c5a738524264f76266fe9435856e425f8a5ece72 into Ironic
changed lower case uuid to upper case UUID in the error messages. Some
tests in ironicclient relied on matching a error message output and were
broken by this change.

subject: Render rabbit SSL config
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-03 09:40:09.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_charm.py', 'charms_openstack/adapters.py', 'charms_openstack/charm.py'], 'message': 'Render rabbit SSL config

* Add SSL properties to RabbitMQRelationAdapter for rendering amqp
  config with SSL options.
* When configuring SSL write out Rabbit CA cert if available
* Look for identity-service ssl configured state if keystone
  interface has not been explicitly passed in. This simplifies the
  SSL configure call in the charm.
* Use contextmanager to check for CA cert change and only run
  update-ca-certificates if a change was detected. While
  update-ca-certificates is running access to remote endpoints
  using SSL is liable to fail as CA certs are unavailable to
  verify remote certs.

Change-Id: I6b7dcfa13dada45de0399aa17677ee6bf5b7be65
'}]
commit_message:
Render rabbit SSL config

* Add SSL properties to RabbitMQRelationAdapter for rendering amqp
  config with SSL options.
* When configuring SSL write out Rabbit CA cert if available
* Look for identity-service ssl configured state if keystone
  interface has not been explicitly passed in. This simplifies the
  SSL configure call in the charm.
* Use contextmanager to check for CA cert change and only run
  update-ca-certificates if a change was detected. While
  update-ca-certificates is running access to remote endpoints
  using SSL is liable to fail as CA certs are unavailable to
  verify remote certs.

Change-Id: I6b7dcfa13dada45de0399aa17677ee6bf5b7be65

On browser windows of small width, Horizon minimizes various
navigational items into two hamburger menus.  However, these menus do
not have the same styling.  This patch ensures that the CSS applied
to both menus is the same.

Closes bug: 1539961

Change-Id: I45fe5e967edcdb42bfb009c2b8f8cf2936c3b78c
'}]
commit_message:
Modification of hamburger menu CSS

On browser windows of small width, Horizon minimizes various
navigational items into two hamburger menus.  However, these menus do
not have the same styling.  This patch ensures that the CSS applied
to both menus is the same.

Closes bug: 1539961

Change-Id: I45fe5e967edcdb42bfb009c2b8f8cf2936c3b78c

commit_message:
Hide migration type from live migration modal

Admin -> Instances -> Actions -> Live Migrate Instance

Hide the migration type on the live migration modal.
Live migration action will try to do the regular live migration with shared
storage first. If it fails, will then try the live block migration.

Change-Id: I80ab7a3be8334977773e88a2045f10caad07234c
Closes-bug: #1496911

subject: Check whether action value is string before calling format()
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-03 09:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/rules.py', 'ironic_inspector/test/unit/test_rules.py', 'releasenotes/notes/check-formatted-value-from-nonstring-3d851cb42ce3a0ac.yaml'], 'message': "Check whether action value is string before calling format()

AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'format' will be raised
if we pass an integer value, so we should check whether the value is

"}]
commit_message:
Check whether action value is string before calling format()

AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'format' will be raised
if we pass an integer value, so we should check whether the value is
a string or not.

Change-Id: I14ed4d404a9be1233493083bef49218cf0f45867
Closes-Bug: #1608393

This removes the code that was stopping event propogation in the

commit_message:
Make angular actions dropdown menu work correctly

This fixes the angular actions menu so that it works as it's supposed
to. After selecting an item in the menu the menu will close.

This removes the code that was stopping event propogation in the
menu that I *think* was added to support the swift dashboard behavior
of selecting rows by clicking anywhere in the row. If that's the case
then it's likely that behavior could be broken by this.

Closes-Bug: #1560313
Change-Id: I46cca911f9b0d23ecede952ff45db39d4b5abd39

commit_message:
Require auth for version api call

The version call may contain information that should not be publicly
discloused without authentication. This change removes the version call
from the public urls which will cause it to require authentication
before responding with version information.

Change-Id: I7352f83ec67321a1fb5caa75fc9168cc01229083

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 12071, 'name': 'Richard Jones', 'email': 'r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com', 'username': 'richard'}, {'_account_id': 12826, 'name': 'Rob Cresswell', 'display_name': 'robcresswell', 'email': 'robert.cresswell@outlook.com', 'username': 'rob-cresswell'}, {'_account_id': 16465, 'name': 'Kristi Nikolla', 'email': 'knikolla@bu.edu', 'username': 'knikolla'}, {'_account_id': 17130, 'name': 'melissaml', 'email': 'ma.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'malei'}, {'_account_id': 21156, 'name': 'Ayush Singh', 'email': 'singh.ay@husky.neu.edu', 'username': 'singh.ay'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-09 01:59:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/keypairs/forms.py'], 'message': 'Don't allow " " as key pair name

This patch fixes the bug where " " space character was accepted while
importing a new Key-Pair in the launch instance modal of the Horizon
Dashboard.
The regex used earlier: "^[\w\- ]+$" allowed spaces in the beginning and at
the end of the keypair which gave birth to inadmissable key-pair results.
Details on the modified variable KEYPAIR_NAME_REGEX:
^   Beginning. Matches the beginning of the string, or the
    beginning of a line if the multiline flag (m) is enabled.
\w  Word. Matches any word character (alphanumeric & underscore).
+   Plus. Match 1 or more of the preceding token.
(?: Non-capturing group. Groups multiple tokens together
    without creating a capture group.
[   Character set. Match any character in the set.
-   Character. Matches a "-" character (char code 45).
    Character. Matches a SPACE character (char code 32).
]
\w  Word. Matches any word character (alphanumeric & underscore).
+   Plus. Match 1 or more of the preceding token.
)
*   Star. Match 0 or more of the preceding token.
$   End. Matches the end of the string,
    or the end of a line if the multiline flag (m) is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1509217

Change-Id: Ied5a259699237f47aa9e4b0c16c85cfe8a1eda15
'}]
commit_message:
Don't allow " " as key pair name

This patch fixes the bug where " " space character was accepted while
importing a new Key-Pair in the launch instance modal of the Horizon
Dashboard.
The regex used earlier: "^[\w\- ]+$" allowed spaces in the beginning and at
the end of the keypair which gave birth to inadmissable key-pair results.
Details on the modified variable KEYPAIR_NAME_REGEX:
^   Beginning. Matches the beginning of the string, or the
    beginning of a line if the multiline flag (m) is enabled.
\w  Word. Matches any word character (alphanumeric & underscore).
+   Plus. Match 1 or more of the preceding token.
(?: Non-capturing group. Groups multiple tokens together
    without creating a capture group.
[   Character set. Match any character in the set.
-   Character. Matches a "-" character (char code 45).
    Character. Matches a SPACE character (char code 32).
]
\w  Word. Matches any word character (alphanumeric & underscore).
+   Plus. Match 1 or more of the preceding token.
)
*   Star. Match 0 or more of the preceding token.
$   End. Matches the end of the string,
    or the end of a line if the multiline flag (m) is enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1509217

Change-Id: Ied5a259699237f47aa9e4b0c16c85cfe8a1eda15

commit_message:
Correct the director in Customizing doc

After make theme changes, we have to re-generate the static
files, while I think the correct command should be
./run_tests.sh -m collecstatic
to overwrite the existing files.

Change-Id: I428bd058cd525cc4a70f62d299af4936c3d0511d

commit_message:
Create project but no display and an error

When i press the create project button,there is no form appear
an error 'Recoverable error: Could not find default role
"_member_" in Keystone' occur
then i take keystoneclient's  roles into settings and get
from it,the settings set default role '_member_' which is not
in keystoneclient's roles

Change-Id: I83e5e7605c57253a7a5b9fa527337b1895af684c
Closes-Bug: #1064433

commit_message:
Splitting Out Connectors from connector.py

This is a larger refactor of the connector.py file. The goal is to
simplfy the file by moving the vendor connector classes to their own
files, and keep only the InitiatorConnector in the connector.py file.
The vendor specific connector tests are also split out into their own
files.

Change-Id: I020e75ca8cd8bec2ad1b38f3ade5cc1f63a4fee5
Implements: bp connector-refactor

commit_message:
verify 'truncate' attr is for columns containing strings only

This will prevent throwing exception if applying truncate
attribute on columns that contain non-strings.
You can test this out by going to:
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/tables.py#141
and adding truncate=2 to vcpus (Integer column) and visiting
Flavors table.

Change-Id: Ic92da3ca18f3e94e1be41738bcd1abb2d3c67cc1
Closes-Bug: #1369944

commit_message:
Angular Table Tutorial

This tutorial walks the developer through creation of the angular table.
It offers two approaches on table creation, quick and declarative, each
with pros and cons.

You can see the changes by clicking on gate-horizon-docs.
To test this patch locally:
1. run ./run_test.sh --docs
2. open doc/build/html/index.html

Change-Id: Ic79e4ea933f098f825691a8bc6d7bfabef25e08b

commit_message:
Bump heatclient dependency to 1.0.0

We use event_utils.poll_for_events in our heat support, but a user needs
at least 1.0.0 for that to work properly.

Change-Id: Ic1c6d243d596947f7475f569c3b125130456a273

commit_message:
Change Layout of Path + Sub Title

With very long URI paths the wrapping either
looks weird or there is no charecter for it to
wrap on.

This moves the URI to its own line, and moves some
of the other elements aroud slightly.

Also changes the font of the subtitle to make it more apparent.

Change-Id: I36e7420224f69eaa5f4dceb18d910b40377b76c4

subject: Fix repo constraints construction and package installation
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-03 10:21:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_pre_build.yml', 'tasks/repo_set_facts.yml', 'templates/requirements_constraints.txt.j2', 'tests/test-repo-build.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/upper-constraints-override-6853ffec6c07d7f5.yaml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "Fix repo constraints construction and package installation

The current repo build process has the following issues:

1. The constraints consruction doesn't properly handle two constraints
   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in both the constraints construction, and
   in the testing.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex and hard to test.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

5. The tests aren't thoroughly checking that the constraints are
   correct.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056
"}]
commit_message:
Fix repo constraints construction and package installation

The current repo build process has the following issues:

1. The constraints consruction doesn't properly handle two constraints
   which use the same name, but have different version specs. eg:
   ovs===2.5.0;python_version=='2.7'
   ovs===2.6.0.dev2;python_version=='3.4'
   This is a problem in both the constraints construction, and
   in the testing.

2. The pip packages installed on the repo server in order to
   construct the repo do not respect the global pins or the upper
   constraint overrides.

3. The constraints are selected based on the requirements specified.
   This makes the process unnecessarily complex and hard to test.

4. The global pins are not applied to the constructed constraints,
   so the wrong packages get built and installed.

5. The tests aren't thoroughly checking that the constraints are
   correct.

This patch corrects all of these issues and hopefully makes the
mechanism for constructing constraints more readily apparent, and
therefore easier to maintain.

Change-Id: If52d073d43081468e2faf2cd063c4b211c29994f
Related-Bug: #1605846
Closes-Bug: #1609056

commit_message:
Refactored the compute model and its elements

In this changeset, I refactored the whole Watcher codebase to
adopt a naming convention about the various elements of the
Compute model so that it reflects the same naming convention
adopted by Nova.

Change-Id: I28adba5e1f27175f025330417b072686134d5f51
Partially-Implements: blueprint cluster-model-objects-wrapper

Partial-Bug: #1608511

commit_message:
Move default network_interface logic in node object

This patch moves the default network_interface logic into the node
object using a field default value. This means if the network_interface
on a node object is ever set to None it'll calculate the default to
place into that field.

Change-Id: I753d969b31ba2d12df4db3fc95a7d9e9ca1e4df6
Partial-Bug: #1608511

Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-30 14:46:41.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/client.py', 'tools/cleanup.sh', 'tools/prepare_nailgun.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Check response from version for auth required

If the version call requires auth, we need to catch that to understand
if we should use auth for making requests.  Previously the version api
call may have been open which allowed the CLI to make the call to
determine if auth should be used. If the version call itself requires
auth, then we need to check the response code to enable authentication
for the api requests.

Change-Id: Ie70d601eb4db4909e52e6afaa15cba6195f24045
Related-Bug: #1585137
(cherry picked from commit 72a7cd19e687460e7414b02960489fa422fe6fce)
'}]
commit_message:
Check response from version for auth required

If the version call requires auth, we need to catch that to understand
if we should use auth for making requests.  Previously the version api
call may have been open which allowed the CLI to make the call to
determine if auth should be used. If the version call itself requires
auth, then we need to check the response code to enable authentication
for the api requests.

Change-Id: Ie70d601eb4db4909e52e6afaa15cba6195f24045
Related-Bug: #1585137
(cherry picked from commit 72a7cd19e687460e7414b02960489fa422fe6fce)

subject: Don't translate OS::Nova::Server image property to UUID
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 16:09:00.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud_heat_plugins/server_update_allowed.py'], 'message': "Don't translate OS::Nova::Server image property to UUID

Ensure that when we specify an image by name, the OS::Nova::Server
resource looks only at the name when deciding whether the property has
changed on an update. Changes in Mitaka mean that the built-in plugin in
Heat translates the name to a UUID.

Change-Id: Ic7a17e35b455f515c4731d4e94401c8971e0ef4b
Closes-Bug: #1609020
"}]
commit_message:
Don't translate OS::Nova::Server image property to UUID

Ensure that when we specify an image by name, the OS::Nova::Server
resource looks only at the name when deciding whether the property has
changed on an update. Changes in Mitaka mean that the built-in plugin in
Heat translates the name to a UUID.

Change-Id: Ic7a17e35b455f515c4731d4e94401c8971e0ef4b
Closes-Bug: #1609020

commit_message:
Implement "network rbac set" command

Add "network rbac set" command which just supports
setting a target project.
Also, This patch adds the doc, unit test and functional test.
But there is a bug of showing network RBAC
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstacksdk/+bug/1608903
We need to skip the functional test before this bug fixed.

Change-Id: I756f448bb333cf1098a735e57a1c5dc4edf195d4
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-client-rbac

commit_message:
Support for Intel X710 NIC

One of our partners discovered that while Intel XL710 NICs are recognized
by deployed MOS 7.0 environment they can't be configured from Fuel even
when using Ubuntu bootstrap.

Change-Id: I7b69e8e74864949848aa14cf4c26f43190fa5ef9
Closes-Bug: #1536615

commit_message:
Fix neutron migrations using raw sql queries

* create networksecuritybindings for each network,
if it isn't exists and set default value (True)
to port_security column

* update network_type and phisnet values for externalnetworks,
set them to default values for fuel-8 release
(network_type = flat phisnet=phisnet1)

Partial-Bug: 1601895
Change-Id: I9838befe52f7a412a70d223ccbde5a9ff7ce8281

commit_message:
Add a hook to process newly created engines

Add on_engine_create argument to transaction_context to enable users
to take some actions with newly created engines. Main intended usage
is providing oslo.db and osprofiler users with a way to hook them
together without making them depend on each other.

Closes-bug: #1600739

Change-Id: I78bef4979c2000d05658ce17d0348cd0a10c24d9

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 13:54:51.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_migration_negative.py'], 'message': "Fix share migration test with snapshot support

Test 'test_migrate_share_with_snapshot_v2_5' validates that
share migration returns an error when a share has a snapshot
created, but to do so, it tries to create a snapshot, which
would fail in a backend that does not support snapshot.
This fix adds a validation that skips the test in this situation.

Change-Id: Icd6b04266ac2de83747b99295cb3538967922d65
Closes-bug: #1608293
"}]
commit_message:
Fix share migration test with snapshot support

Test 'test_migrate_share_with_snapshot_v2_5' validates that
share migration returns an error when a share has a snapshot
created, but to do so, it tries to create a snapshot, which
would fail in a backend that does not support snapshot.
This fix adds a validation that skips the test in this situation.

Change-Id: Icd6b04266ac2de83747b99295cb3538967922d65
Closes-bug: #1608293

commit_message:
Generate CephX keys and FSID regardless of CephStorageCount

This will change the client behavior so that it always generate
the CephX keys and the cluster FSID regardless of which value is
given as CephStorageCount, to cope with hyperconverged scenarios.

Change-Id: I64acd6a4ed1b56fddfd366b5846dba3c22300df4
Related-Bug: 1601864
(cherry picked from commit 694d097c5fd3db8026b43ea577dc0548fcd6ca4e)

commit_message:
Remove an outdated directory in tox.ini

The directory openstack/common from the exclude list of
flake8 in tox.ini was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
but oslo-incubator was retired, so don't use this directory
any more.

commit_message:
Remove 'default' theme styles

The default theme houses lots of styles that intended to maintain
style parity with legacy Horizon during the themability effort.
Because Horizon is mostly ingesting native bootstrap now, we can
just remove the 'default' theme entirely and use vanilla Bootstrap
styles for Basic Horizon moving forward.

implements: blueprint horizon-bootstrap-styles
Change-Id: I76f48265321037d1bc71b52cd7a86531548816ba

commit_message:
Fix AddressPool._safe_create_network

- transaction.atomic was used improperly.
  transaction.rollback() will be called at atomic.__exit__
  in case of error
- Added DevopsError for duplicate names and networks
- Added unit tests

Closes-Bug: #1598141
Closes-Bug: #1597025
Closes-bug: #1607342
Change-Id: I024c29761048447446a09ac4439cca66e60b11d4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 16:38:05.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/glusterfs_native.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/test_glusterfs_native.py'], 'message': "glusterfs_native: fix parsing of the dynamic-auth option

The full name of the 'dynamic-auth' GlusterFS option
is 'server.dynamic-auth'. When we started to make use
of it in https://review.openstack.org/229409, we just
used its short form, 'dynamic-auth'. That actually
*should* work but due to some weakness in the GlusterFS
instrumentation code, it doesn't.

Fix the situation for now by using the full option
name. We also take the opportunity to remove some
redundant checks from the respective option handling
code.

Change-Id: I6f30060cec38733afa1211cb8e7bc57b66dead34
Closes-Bug: #1506577
(cherry picked from commit c38d4969533efbd99e586f935edddf10a63e64a4)
"}]
commit_message:
glusterfs_native: fix parsing of the dynamic-auth option

The full name of the 'dynamic-auth' GlusterFS option
is 'server.dynamic-auth'. When we started to make use
of it in https://review.openstack.org/229409, we just
used its short form, 'dynamic-auth'. That actually
*should* work but due to some weakness in the GlusterFS
instrumentation code, it doesn't.

Fix the situation for now by using the full option
name. We also take the opportunity to remove some
redundant checks from the respective option handling
code.

Change-Id: I6f30060cec38733afa1211cb8e7bc57b66dead34
Closes-Bug: #1506577
(cherry picked from commit c38d4969533efbd99e586f935edddf10a63e64a4)

Add direct_use=False flag to constructor of novaclient

commit_message:
Enhance notification doc generation with samples

Until now the notification devref only contained a link to the sample file
and that link did only exist after the sample file was merged.
This is suboptimal as the locally generated doc might be incomplete.

This patch changes the doc to contain the content of the sample file.

Change-Id: I4343a2feb13de8b614e8d42d5f1db14102ab492e

commit_message:
Add server name verification in instance search

There are Nova API calls that can accept a server name
as a regex parameter. For example, if the command
'nova list --name <some_pattern>' is invoked with
an incorrect value of the pattern, the nova-api makes
a request to database and returns Http 500 error. Seems
it's not convenient.

This fix checks the pattern. If it isn't correct,
the nova-api returns error 400 with a prompt of a bad regex.

Change-Id: Iad63c668d09ec6a82ace29700fb4949c1acfbe1c
Closes-Bug: #1603728

pollutes the test log with the deprecation warnings.
In this patchset, I fixed them in the unit tests.

Partial-Bug: #1606647

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 20:46:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/image/glance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py'], 'message': "Default image.size to 0 when extracting v1 image attributes

When we snapshot a non-volume-backed instance, we create an
image in nova.compute.api.API._create_image and set some
values from the instance but 'size' isn't one of them.

Later in the virt driver's snapshot method, at least for
libvirt, it gets the snapshot image from the image API (glance)
and when using glance v1 (use_glance_v1=True) the _extract_attributes
method in nova.image.glance pulls the attributes out of the v1 image
response to the form that nova expects. This code assumes that
the 'size' attribute is set on the image, which for a snapshot image
it might not be (yet anyway). This results in an AttributeError.

This change defaults the size attribute value to 0 if it's not set.
If it is set, but to None, we still use 0 as before.

Change-Id: I14b0e44a7268231c2b19f013b563f0b8f09c2e88
Closes-Bug: #1606707
"}]
commit_message:
Default image.size to 0 when extracting v1 image attributes

When we snapshot a non-volume-backed instance, we create an
image in nova.compute.api.API._create_image and set some
values from the instance but 'size' isn't one of them.

Later in the virt driver's snapshot method, at least for
libvirt, it gets the snapshot image from the image API (glance)
and when using glance v1 (use_glance_v1=True) the _extract_attributes
method in nova.image.glance pulls the attributes out of the v1 image
response to the form that nova expects. This code assumes that
the 'size' attribute is set on the image, which for a snapshot image
it might not be (yet anyway). This results in an AttributeError.

This change defaults the size attribute value to 0 if it's not set.
If it is set, but to None, we still use 0 as before.

Change-Id: I14b0e44a7268231c2b19f013b563f0b8f09c2e88
Closes-Bug: #1606707

commit_message:
Validate node id for log handler

This change updates the log handler to validate that the node id being
passed in is an integer. If it is not an integer, the response will be a
400.

Change-Id: Ida7a18a7261bf7fa98518a059d1de42690382d79
Closes-Bug: #1585160

commit_message:
Do not print unhandled exception if in production

This change removes the printing of unhandled exceptions when not in
development mode. We should never return the unhandled exception
information when not in development mode.

Logging nailgun exceptions
Now there is a special "processor" devoted to this

Change-Id: I820f5682d0fac292722a9f205965516771333a4d
Closes-Bug: #1585160
(cherry picked from commit c61fbc616fc6763c358ad70dac37341f65ddcb19)

subject: Fix the issue introduced by Neutron config file refactorying
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 06:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py', 'tricircle/tests/base.py'], 'message': "Fix the issue introduced by Neutron config file refactorying

1.What is the problem
core_opts has been moved from neutron/common/config.py to
neutron/conf/common.py, the migration leads the py27 test failured
in tricircle/tests/base.py.

2.What's need to be fixed:
import common.py from neutron/conf/common.py instead from
from neutron/common/config.py

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
fix the py27 check and gate test error introduced by Neutron
config file refactorying.

Change-Id: Icab2d6a2e25cc3387e5ee9951cc0b53491e012ee
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the issue introduced by Neutron config file refactorying

1.What is the problem
core_opts has been moved from neutron/common/config.py to
neutron/conf/common.py, the migration leads the py27 test failured
in tricircle/tests/base.py.

2.What's need to be fixed:
import common.py from neutron/conf/common.py instead from
from neutron/common/config.py

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
fix the py27 check and gate test error introduced by Neutron
config file refactorying.

Change-Id: Icab2d6a2e25cc3387e5ee9951cc0b53491e012ee
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

We recently added a new integration test for purge to check purge per

Change-Id: I9f0b97adae9ea532bc2453441c327e30b849d006
Closes-Bug: #1608910

commit_message:
Remove additional purge test

We recently added a new integration test for purge to check purge per
project. It doesn't provide much more testing, and we can't actually
have 2 purge tests because they can't run in parallel to each other, so
let's remove it for now.

Change-Id: I9f0b97adae9ea532bc2453441c327e30b849d006
Closes-Bug: #1608910

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 21:57:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/quota_sets.py'], 'message': 'Remove unused validation code for quota_sets

The values of quota_sets are validated on JSON-Schema before the
API operation, so the validation code is never used.
This patch removes the code for its cleanup.

Change-Id: I6b2278ecb7b216ad02220dad0647c0847513604d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused validation code for quota_sets

The values of quota_sets are validated on JSON-Schema before the
API operation, so the validation code is never used.
This patch removes the code for its cleanup.

Change-Id: I6b2278ecb7b216ad02220dad0647c0847513604d

commit_message:
Remove nova.cache_utils oslo.config.opts entrypoint

There was never a list_opts method in nova.cache_utils,
and the options registeration was moved to nova.conf.cache
in 466bce576a69d170f1ef08264da7e72ac4a150fb so we can
cleanup the entrypoint.

Change-Id: If02620752c1bb018117f2c6755d9b9661185e4d6

commit_message:
Bump API version number and date

As a result of commit I37136f79488d7469f0b8b24e3f5628899e40cac0,
the API version for v3 is now 3.7. This patch also updates the
API version updated date to that of the expected release date of
Newton.

commit_message:
Reminder that release notes are built from commits

This patch introduces a new tools/releasenotes_tox.sh script for the
tox -e releasenotes test environment. It will detect when there are
uncommitted release notes and print a reminder to commit them.

Change-Id: I54af12d7eb20b37263e23443900745884cffacea

o.vo has a fixture for testing compatibility routines. This changes the
nova unit tests to use that compatibility testing on all objects. In the
original nova test, the versions tested were from 1.0 to 1.(x-1), where
1.x is the current version. o.vo's fixture tests from 1.0 to 1.x, which
should be a no-op, but is also a good thing to test (if we can't convert

in the different objects, which was a bug in nova, but using that

commit_message:
Use ovo in test_obj_make_compatible()

o.vo has a fixture for testing compatibility routines. This changes the
nova unit tests to use that compatibility testing on all objects. In the
original nova test, the versions tested were from 1.0 to 1.(x-1), where
1.x is the current version. o.vo's fixture tests from 1.0 to 1.x, which
should be a no-op, but is also a good thing to test (if we can't convert
1.x to 1.x, that's a bad thing).

o.vo also had an enhancement where it passed args and kwargs to __init__
in the different objects, which was a bug in nova, but using that
fixture allows us to also close the nova bug. This change in o.vo was
I62646b99adca47a9c9fe0f466f7a23ac8fa4553e.

Change-Id: Ie127f55f2e5bcd383796ff51253cf1091be16c98
Closes-Bug: #1537882

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-14 18:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Validate pci_passthrough_whitelist when starting n-cpu

Loading up CONF.pci_passthrough_whitelist in the Whitelist
object performs a bunch of validation and can fail in several
different ways (invalid json, invalid values, invalid combinations
of keys, devices not found, etc). This happens today when
creating the PciDevTracker in the ResourceTracker when updating
available resources. If the configuration is bad, it kills the
periodic task to update available resources on the compute node.

We should just load up the pci_passthrough_whitelist (if set)
when starting the nova-compute service so we can fail fast and
kill the service on any misconfiguration rather than run with
a broken service.

Change-Id: If50fb837b490042bb5ef20e9ad843b28f871a44e
Closes-Bug: #1603034
'}]
commit_message:
Validate pci_passthrough_whitelist when starting n-cpu

Loading up CONF.pci_passthrough_whitelist in the Whitelist
object performs a bunch of validation and can fail in several
different ways (invalid json, invalid values, invalid combinations
of keys, devices not found, etc). This happens today when
creating the PciDevTracker in the ResourceTracker when updating
available resources. If the configuration is bad, it kills the
periodic task to update available resources on the compute node.

We should just load up the pci_passthrough_whitelist (if set)
when starting the nova-compute service so we can fail fast and
kill the service on any misconfiguration rather than run with
a broken service.

Change-Id: If50fb837b490042bb5ef20e9ad843b28f871a44e
Closes-Bug: #1603034

subject: Implement retries for SSH check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 08:31:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/container_create.yml'], 'message': "Implement retries for SSH check

Most of often when Ansible can't connect to the container, it has
started up and appears to still be in the process of completing
the startup.

This implements retries for the SSH connection to increase the
chance of success.

Change-Id: I55f95628905180add79e2548e0553ca15dd19e2b
"}]
commit_message:
Implement retries for SSH check

Most of often when Ansible can't connect to the container, it has
started up and appears to still be in the process of completing
the startup.

This implements retries for the SSH connection to increase the
chance of success.

Change-Id: I55f95628905180add79e2548e0553ca15dd19e2b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 8119, 'name': 'Eric Brown', 'email': 'eric_wade_brown@yahoo.com', 'username': 'ericwb'}, {'_account_id': 9459, 'name': '.Haifeng Yan', 'email': 'yanheven@qq.com', 'username': 'yan'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 17862, 'name': 'Kseniya Tychkova', 'email': 'kseniya.tychkova@gmail.com', 'username': 'ktychkova'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-14 16:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/policy.py', 'oslo_policy/tests/test_policy.py'], 'message': 'Allow policy file to not exist

Now that policy rules can be registered in code there is a desire to run
projects without a policy file. However oslo.policy assumed a policy
file would exist and would raise an error if it could not be found. This
changes that behavior to not error if a policy file is not found.

Because there are now tools which can generate policy files which list
the defaults, or list the effective policy there is no requirement that
a policy file be used in order to examine the policy that is in use. So
it should be possible to run without one.

Change-Id: Ia82df77f7a65aa1f3e3eaa7ed949103fa73fb603
'}]
commit_message:
Allow policy file to not exist

Now that policy rules can be registered in code there is a desire to run
projects without a policy file. However oslo.policy assumed a policy
file would exist and would raise an error if it could not be found. This
changes that behavior to not error if a policy file is not found.

Because there are now tools which can generate policy files which list
the defaults, or list the effective policy there is no requirement that
a policy file be used in order to examine the policy that is in use. So
it should be possible to run without one.

Change-Id: Ia82df77f7a65aa1f3e3eaa7ed949103fa73fb603

commit_message:
[config-ref] reorder drivers by community and vendors

Docs team focuses on the drivers by open source software.
Also, docs for a few verdor drivers are not maintained well.
To highlight the OSS drivers, move them up.

Change-Id: I1760af95d8eafa0bbb3e0a1e9617f20dcbf6ddaf

commit_message:
Replace minified jquery by source version

The file www/static/common/js/jquery-1.11.0.js is a source-less
non-free blob, which wouldn't fit in downstream distributions.
This patch replaces it by jquery-1.11.3.js in a non-minified
way.

Partial-Bug: 1501641
Change-Id: Ia7088601423f1fad0681bef4521ba4c114101d3a

Change-Id: Id6c41a181e3c7010e514813d123e8e61f6da86ad

commit_message:
Use inspect.signature instead of inspect.getargspec for PY3

`inspect.getargspec()` was deprecated in Python 3.0 and will be
removed in 3.6 (ETA late 2016).

From Python 3.5 it started throwing a deprecation warning which leds
some tests failures.

Change-Id: Id6c41a181e3c7010e514813d123e8e61f6da86ad
