commit_message:
Add objects.ServiceList.get_all_computes_by_hv_type

This adds a new method to the service list object to get all compute
service records for a given hypervisor type. It's queried with a join to
the compute_nodes table, as that's the only place hypervisor type is
stored.

Change-Id: Ic044362d232e340145fa30f100c3e5e37abb5e6e

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install_yum.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-state-bb93a1d4b272425d.yaml', 'tasks/install_apt.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I3227dc6f15e0307926e65427bc635c34e2baa87f
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I3227dc6f15e0307926e65427bc635c34e2baa87f

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-22 13:23:48.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20160707-limited-use-of-alternate-prog-languages.rst'], 'message': 'Limited Use of Alternate Programming Languages (Go)

This resolution provides a template for adding other
languages for use and adds Go as the first language
for limited use.

The TC should be able to approve other languages based
on the same steps later.

Projects do not have to come to TC for using Go, they
can get specs approved in openstack-specs repo with
sufficient community input.

Change-Id: I38da335aed1f057c68184c6be406b1d18fad9b57
'}]
commit_message:
Limited Use of Alternate Programming Languages (Go)

This resolution provides a template for adding other
languages for use and adds Go as the first language
for limited use.

The TC should be able to approve other languages based
on the same steps later.

Projects do not have to come to TC for using Go, they
can get specs approved in openstack-specs repo with
sufficient community input.

Change-Id: I38da335aed1f057c68184c6be406b1d18fad9b57

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 19:01:02.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/helpers/decorators.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/environment.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/nailgun_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/helpers/http.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_ha_one_controller.py'], 'message': 'Replace custom HTTPClient by standard keystoneauth1 session

1. Use keystoneauth1 for making session
2. Nailgun/OSTF client uses keystoneauth1 session
3. Drop HTTPClient
4. Support NailgunClient construction by providing session
5. Requests has on-demand authorization and re-authorization
    by keystoneauth1.

Pros:
* interface unification, after implementation of bugfix fr 1581024
  we could transparently switch the most methods
  from our implmentation to python-fuelclient implementation.
* Less decorators magic (@jsonparse is not required)

Blueprint: python-fuel-client-in-system-tests
Change-Id: Idc0c0b3b0039f64d852ea1a08e02a9c3ecd65c46
(cherry picked from commit 92006f3)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace custom HTTPClient by standard keystoneauth1 session

1. Use keystoneauth1 for making session
2. Nailgun/OSTF client uses keystoneauth1 session
3. Drop HTTPClient
4. Support NailgunClient construction by providing session
5. Requests has on-demand authorization and re-authorization
    by keystoneauth1.

Pros:
* interface unification, after implementation of bugfix fr 1581024
  we could transparently switch the most methods
  from our implmentation to python-fuelclient implementation.
* Less decorators magic (@jsonparse is not required)

Blueprint: python-fuel-client-in-system-tests
Change-Id: Idc0c0b3b0039f64d852ea1a08e02a9c3ecd65c46
(cherry picked from commit 92006f3)

commit_message:
Allow tox to be run with python 3

The tox.ini has some unicode characters that cannot be
decoded, so just executing tox will immediately cause an error
because the tox.ini cannot be parsed.

Change-Id: I32a53cc4b019445f1f7a1dca847f14eba4bda81c
Closes-Bug: #1600068
(cherry picked from commit 7f87f63911e1a10519d7b1da160cf55fbd4335cc)

commit_message:
Remove old Orchestration API files

The Orchestration APIs are now managed by the heat team in
openstack/heat respository. This patch removes the obsoleted version to
avoid confusion and/or inconsistency.

Change-Id: I5ebf8a4970be38e962148ec24249740b1c27225f

commit_message:
Remove `dagre-d3/demo` which breaks the devstack installation

commit_message:
Fix cluster resource in cluster service

The 'parent' property has been masked out from service side for a long
time, exposing this to users is only causing confusing. This patch
removes the 'parent' property from the Cluster resource.

Change-Id: Icc69ff41a8cbebd664db138d7a0bc6430994d81f

commit_message:
Remove Clustering API files

The Clustering API will be managed by the senlin team in the
openstack/senlin repository. This patch removes the old files to avoid
confusion/inconsistency.

subject: Fix Gate HA test Failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 07:40:58.000000000', 'files': ['congress/common/config.py', 'congress/api/datasource_model.py', 'congress/tests/etc/congress.conf.test', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/tests2/api/test_datasource_model.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/dse2/dse_node.py', 'congress/tests2/api/base.py', 'congress/tests2/test_congress.py'], 'message': 'Fix Gate HA test Failure

This commit fixes the HA issue happenning from time to time.
The problem is with explict call to create/delete datasource
policy in add_datasource/delete_datasource which is causing
the error, if synchronizer is run between the 2 statements.

So, in this commit removed the explicit call to create/delete
policies and let synchronizer take care of the same in next
periodic iteration.

Change-Id: I61d947c7f925703c3f458b24481c29307f580989
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Gate HA test Failure

This commit fixes the HA issue happenning from time to time.
The problem is with explict call to create/delete datasource
policy in add_datasource/delete_datasource which is causing
the error, if synchronizer is run between the 2 statements.

So, in this commit removed the explicit call to create/delete
policies and let synchronizer take care of the same in next
periodic iteration.

Change-Id: I61d947c7f925703c3f458b24481c29307f580989

subject: Exit if datasource could not be loaded
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-01 05:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['congress/common/config.py', 'congress/harness.py', 'congress/dse2/dse_node.py'], 'message': 'Exit if datasource could not be loaded

This commit exits code, if any datasource driver could not be loaded
and also provides a new option --delete_missing_driver_datasources to be
specified while starting congress server, to cleanup any stale datasources
from database.

Eg: /usr/local/bin/congress-server --config-file /etc/congress/congress.conf --delete_missing_driver_datasources

Closes-Bug: #1606523
Change-Id: Iee260b0d4204ece6b8347d1fe578cbc52d9ccc57
'}]
commit_message:
Exit if datasource could not be loaded

This commit exits code, if any datasource driver could not be loaded
and also provides a new option --delete_missing_driver_datasources to be
specified while starting congress server, to cleanup any stale datasources
from database.

Eg: /usr/local/bin/congress-server --config-file /etc/congress/congress.conf --delete_missing_driver_datasources

Closes-Bug: #1606523
Change-Id: Iee260b0d4204ece6b8347d1fe578cbc52d9ccc57

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:18:59.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-apt.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-state-f2309b07440d0ae8.yaml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Ib58ccc89b868f42295425527eb1a9dbcbe21839c
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: Ib58ccc89b868f42295425527eb1a9dbcbe21839c

set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state

Change-Id: I1286c0f860227f75f7e53e28dcaa360e607259ce

commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I1286c0f860227f75f7e53e28dcaa360e607259ce

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:28:46.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/actions/openstack/actions.py'], 'message': 'Add _get_fake_client to ironic-inspector actions

When populating the ironic-inspector actions, the client code tries
to get a proper version (since none was given). And thus, in that
code it may fail if inspector is not listening on localhost (which is
what it tries to access by default). By setting the version in the
_get_fake_client call, we avoid this call.

Change-Id: I34d4739392a0d7c2967c1bc4ebf24d7ff5a56ab3
'}]
commit_message:
Add _get_fake_client to ironic-inspector actions

When populating the ironic-inspector actions, the client code tries
to get a proper version (since none was given). And thus, in that
code it may fail if inspector is not listening on localhost (which is
what it tries to access by default). By setting the version in the
_get_fake_client call, we avoid this call.

Change-Id: I34d4739392a0d7c2967c1bc4ebf24d7ff5a56ab3

subject: Add ability to change apt/yum package state
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 21:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/package-state-34d9aa6d4c7aeffe.yaml', 'tasks/cloudkitty_install_apt.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/cloudkitty_install_yum.yml'], 'message': 'Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I20c3e2c1c63c2ad90835ac60c84d032197ea527c
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to change apt/yum package state

The current method of installing the distribution packages required is
set in the tasks and cannot be changed by a deployer.

Currently the apt task always installs the latest package. This results
in unexpected binary changes when a deployer may simply be trying to
execute a configuration change.

This patch adds the ability for a deployer to change the desired state
so that the results are predictable.

Change-Id: I20c3e2c1c63c2ad90835ac60c84d032197ea527c

This patch satisfies the following PCI-DSS password history
requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

commit_message:
PCI-DSS Password history requirements

This patch satisfies the following PCI-DSS password history
requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.5: Do not allow an individual to submit a new
password/phrase that is the same as any of the last four
passwords/phrases he or she has used.

This feature is configurable; thus, not allowing users to change their
password if it matches a configurable number of previous passwords.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss
Change-Id: I3765cd71463de7f0c7b2c1066ca8848f194c94f1

commit_message:
Fix unreachable TimeOutException bug in amphora driver

Faulty logic in the amphora REST API driver prevented a TimeOutException from being thrown when appropriate.
This commit fixes this bug and adds a unit test to ensure proper behavior.

Closes-Bug: 1583558

Change-Id: I8b8ddbf8ac93c51ad15b4c5d107138913be25bbf

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 08:48:25.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Run local CA trust before haproxy deployment

Before haproxy tries to use the TLS certificates it should already
trust the CA. So it's necessary for the local CA-related manifest to
notify the ::tripleo::haproxy class.

This works for newly set deployments. deployments that have already

Change-Id: I32ded4e33abffd51f220fb8a7dc6263aace72acd
"}]
commit_message:
Run local CA trust before haproxy deployment

Before haproxy tries to use the TLS certificates it should already
trust the CA. So it's necessary for the local CA-related manifest to
notify the ::tripleo::haproxy class.

This works for newly set deployments. deployments that have already
ran the ca-trust section will already trust the CA and thus won't
need that part.

Change-Id: I32ded4e33abffd51f220fb8a7dc6263aace72acd

commit_message:
Remove container object

Following on from removing the k8s specific APIs in
I1f6f04a35dfbb39f217487fea104ded035b75569 the objects associated with
these APIs need removal.

Remove the container object, drop the db table and remove references to
the container object. The docker_conductor has also been removed as this
was used for managing containers using Magnum objects.

Change-Id: I288fa7a9717519b1ae8195820975676d99b4d6d2
Partially-Implements: blueprint delete-container-endpoint
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

commit_message:

that ignores 'DOWN' Neutron port status for baremetal instance.
